title: Data Architect
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 re looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Architect to join our dynamic team. In this crucial role, you will be instrumental in fostering a data-driven culture across our organisation, enabling departments to leverage data comprehensively and facilitating data teams in building models, AI, and machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Your expertise will drive the development and maintenance of our state- of-the-art cloud-based data platform, which is central to powering our globally recognized brand. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Define data models, standards, and governance policies to ensure consistent and high-quality data across the organisation.
* Identify and evaluate emerging technologies and trends in data management and analytics, recommending strategic adoption to enhance data capabilities.
* Design and implement scalable and maintainable data pipelines and data platforms, leveraging cloud platform tools and technologies such as AWS and GCP
* Develop a system that enables seamless operation across multiple regulated markets simultaneously.
* Effectively communicate the value and impact of data architecture to various stakeholders, ensuring alignment and buy-in.
* Ensure architectural integrity and compliance with data governance and security policies.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* 7+ years of work experience in data engineers and data platforms
* Must have experience in successfully implementing data-centric applications
* Expert knowledge with SQL, ETL, data modelling, and Python
* Experience working with terabyte to petabyte scale data
* Designing technical solutions and teaching team members.
* Building solutions for multiple concurrent regulated markets


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: CFO Greenely
description:
**Join Us as the CFO of Greenely: Pioneers in Sustainable Energy Transformation!**
 Are you ready to make a monumental impact in the dynamic world of sustainable energy? Greenely, a visionary scale-up company dedicated to a greener planet, is on the hunt for a visionary CFO to steer our financial ship and be a crucial architect of our bright future.
   

  

**Profile Description**
 We are currently searching for a CFO to become a central part of our management team to help the company's development moving forward. The role requires deep understanding of financial & commercial analysis, processes, forecasting and reporting. Therefore, we believe that you are a person with a strong business mind, have excellent analytical skills and are a very driven person motivated by complex challenges who thrives in a business that is characterized by quick decisions and a fast pace. Furthermore, you are highly result-oriented, organized and are used to working in a dynamic environment with tight deadlines.
   

  

 You’ll report directly to the CEO and work in close collaboration with other members of the management team.
   

  

**Your Mission:**
 As the CFO, you'll play a pivotal role in Greenely's journey. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Control Financial Metrics: You'll ensure our financial metrics are spot-on, from cash flow to revenue and expenses, and provide sharp financial reporting to our CEO and board.
* Budget & Financial Planning: You'll own and develop our budget, cash flow forecasts, P&L, and balance sheet reports.
* Reporting & KPIs: You'll take charge of our business and financial KPIs, streamlining and automating our reporting processes.
* Financial Close & Accounting: You'll be the guardian of our monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close procedures, while overseeing the audit process.
* Electricity Operations: Managing and developing our electricity operations, you'll evaluate financial strategies for various trading items and oversee finances and risks.
* Cash & Tax Management: Optimizing cash management and handling tax-related matters will be your domain.
* Capital Structure & Financing: Alongside our CEO, you'll steer our capital structure, managing both debt and equity financing.
* Investor & Board Relations: As our CFO, you'll be the face of Greenely to our investors, board of directors, and shareholders, keeping them in the loop with exceptional reporting and ad-hoc presentations.


**Your Qualifications:**
 We're seeking a CFO who is as visionary as we are. The ideal candidate should have:
   

  

* Proven CFO Experience: You bring a wealth of experience, with a full suite of financial skills, including investor relations, financial reporting, financial control, financial planning and analysis, and more.
* Digital B2C Leadership: Your leadership in a digital B2C company is a must, proving your financial acumen.
* Electricity Industry Insight: Experience in the electricity supply industry is key, with knowledge of financial electricity operations, structure, and risks.
* Venture Capital Expertise: If you've worked with venture capital or private equity, it's a big plus.
* Startup Savvy: Experience in a venture capital-backed startup or scale-up is a strong merit.
* Language Proficiency: Your command of Swedish and English, both written and oral, is excellent.


**What You Get in Return:**
 Your journey with Greenely promises to be as rewarding as it is impactful. Here's what we offer:
   

  

* Ambitious Sustainability: Join us in pioneering a sustainable planet. Make a lasting difference with your expertise.
* Competitive Salary: We value your contribution and offer a competitive salary.
* Health & Wellness: Enjoy extended health insurance and wellness allowance, plus dedicated wellness/exercise hours during work.
* Incredible Team: Collaborate with talented and super-friendly colleagues who share your passion.


**About Greenely:**
 Greenely is on a mission to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. As a digital energy provider, we help people reduce their electricity costs by optimizing their home and car's electricity usage with our smart app. Supported by Nordic venture capital companies, we aim to enable households worldwide to connect, control, and optimize their energy usage. We believe that the best electricity is the one that is never used - a win-win for both wallets and the environment!

title: Medical Science Liaison - Nordics
description:
The MSL is a field-based medical colleague responsible for providing medical & scientific information and medical education as well as medical insight generation for the influenza/COVID landscape and CSL Seqirus licensed and (as appropriate) the late-stage portfolio of vaccines. The region of responsibility may include the whole of Nordics ( Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland) under the supervision of the Medical Lead Nordics, based in Denmark.
   

  

 This role requires a high ability to understand, interpret and clearly communicate clinical and scientific data and information and maintain a high level of collaboration with medical and commercial operations functions. All activities should at all times be in line with CSL Seqirus regional medical strategic objectives as well as ensure to act in compliance and respect of all national laws and regulations and CSL Seqirus compliance standards.
   

  

 This role aims to build credible and durable relationships with health care professionals (in particular key opinion leaders and scientific societies) and other relevant external stakeholders.
   

  

 This role offers multiple opportunities to work closely with Global functions, such as HEOR, Market Access and RWE.
   

  

**Principal Accountabilities**
**1 - External facing**
* Communicate new and other important approved medical content to targeted health care professionals (HCPs) in local, regional or national capacities including Vaccines HCP decision-makers, national and regional key opinion leaders, national and regional professional associations, payers groups at regional and national level, government organizations, primary care key stakeholders at regional level and any other HCP who may be considered an influencer for flu protection in the Nordics.
* Provide externally truthful, accurate and scientifically supported information in response to unsolicited medical requests from HCPs and other stakeholders in a manner that complies with all applicable ethical, governmental and Seqirus guidelines, policies, and procedures (e.g. medical inquiries, scientific congress participation, etc.).
* Provide internally product and indication expertise for any CSL Seqirus/CSL Vifor or Behring colleagues (e.g. field force training, develop and update medical slides, medical review and copy clearance, etc.).
* Deliver presentations to relevant stakeholders in accordance with the designated medical strategy established by the Nordic, European (EMEA), UK and Global Medical Affairs team.
* Facilitate communication between HCPs and HCOs, any healthcare decision maker and Medical Affairs colleagues.
* Facilitate both CSL Seqirus sponsored clinical trial, collaborative research, and investigator-initiated research activities, as determined by Medical Affairs and in accordance with Seqirus SOPs (Seqirus sponsored research site/investigator interactions, IIR inquiries, etc.).
* Facilitate and support Medical Affairs contribution to awareness and education of all stakeholders in close collaboration with internal functions.
* Search actively for customer insights that contribute to the development of product medical strategies and provide these to Seqirus as appropriate.


**2 – Internal facing and Cross-Functional Collaboration**
* Work closely in the local medical team to ensure insight generation and engagement with HCPs and in particular KOLs are captured, shared and escalated as needed.
* Provide internally product and indication expertise for any Seqirus/CSL colleagues (e.g. field force training, develop and update medical slides, medical review and copy clearance, etc.)
* Engage and collaborate with Public Affairs, Market access, Policy, Sales Team, Customer Services, Communications at a local level and Medical Affairs teams at regional EMEA and when necessary at a global level


**3 – Compliance**
* Act at all times in a manner that is consistent with the CSL Seqirus behaviours and values (Superior performance, innovation, integrity, collaboration, patient-focus)
* Ensure compliance with all internal and external policies, procedures and regulations e.g. Code of Practice, financial processes
* Participate to all compliance training in line with timelines and Code of Practice requirements
* Contribute to internal signatory/approval process


**Minimum Education Requirements**
 Scientific Degree as Medical Doctor (MD) or PhD in other life science (e.g. biology, immunology, infectious diseases, public-health, chemistry…)
   

  

**Minimum Experience Requirements**
* 5 years of experience following the last stage of training, including 2 or more years of experience in clinical and/or health services education or research (preferably in the pharmaceutical industry).
* Experience with clinical research and/or pharmaceutical industry as MSL or other relevant position
* Experience in influenza, infectious diseases, epidemiology, vaccines, public health and the Nordics health care system
* Fluent in English and Swedish/Danish/Norwegian
* Holds a driving license valid in Sweden/ Norway/Denmark
* Willing to travel across the Nordics and internationally according to business needs
* Required to be flexible in working hours


**About CSL Vifor**
 CSL Vifor aims to become the global leader in iron deficiency and nephrology.
   

  

 The company is a partner of choice for pharmaceuticals and innovative patient-focused solutions across iron, dialysis, nephrology and rare conditions. CSL Vifor strives to help patients around the world with severe, chronic and rare diseases lead better, healthier lives. It specializes in strategic global partnering, in-licensing and developing, manufacturing and marketing pharmaceutical products for precision patient care.
   

  

 For more information, please visit viforpharma.com
   

  

**We want CSL to reflect the world around us**
 As a global organization with employees in 35+ countries, CSL embraces diversity and inclusion. Learn more about Diversity & Inclusion at CSL.
   

  

**Do work that matters at CSL Vifor!**

title: CRM Manager Sports - Sweden
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Join LeoVegas Group as a CRM Manager Sports - Sweden, where you'll lead the development and execution of multi-channel CRM strategies and activities aimed at enhancing player loyalty and lifetime value while achieving business objectives. Using a data-driven approach, you'll develop and implement CRM strategies to drive engagement, retention, and profitability. Collaboration will be key as you work closely with your team and cross-functional teams to identify common goals, opportunities for efficiency, and innovative ideas.
   

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**
* Through a data led approach develop and execute multi-channel CRM strategies and activities to enhance player loyalty and lifetime value, and deliver on business objectives.
* Budget and planning: Ensure campaigns are planned with expected volumes, response rates, costs, ROI and success criteria so they can be assessed and measured accurately.
* Continuously monitor and optimise campaigns and customer journeys to improve user experience, drive customer retention and value and ensure maximum profitability. Initiatives should have experimentation built in which means having a testable hypothesis, versions to test and a learnable outcome.
* Leverage advanced data analytics and segmentation techniques to gain deeper insights into player behaviours and preferences, enabling the creation of personalised and relevant communication and campaigns that further drives engagement, value and optimises the player experience across all touch points.
* As an assigned campaign owner, you are accountable for the successful end-to-end delivery of campaigns, as well as monitoring and managing all marketing communications, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and a flawless customer experience.
* Work closely with your squad and the wider team, as well as collaborate with cross-functional teams, to identify common goals, opportunities for efficiency, and share or borrow innovative ideas.
* Clear, accurate, and timely briefing to ensure we get engaging creative execution, relevant targeting, informative tests and faultless builds.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, regulations, competitors, and best practices to ensure the CRM strategy remains competitive


**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:**
* You have 1-2 years of CRM experience and knowledge of the Swedish market.
* You are a Swedish speaker. Understanding of any other language is a plus.
* You have a strong Sports knowledge.
* You are a positive, creative and data-driven person who loves to push the limits, try new things and are results-driven.
* You are a team player, willing to share your knowledge and learn from your colleagues while enjoying a dynamic and creative environment – whilst also capable of working independently.
* You have excellent planning and time organisation skills and of course - superb attention to detail.
* Last but not least, you will have a genuine interest in our product.


**BENEFITS:**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


**JOIN US:**
 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

* As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Finance Manager
description:
*Are you a visionary financial leader with a proven track record of establishing a successful finance function who is excited about joining a fast-paced, growth-oriented company? Are you motivated by responsibilities, financial analysis, and a role that is both operational and strategic? This could be your match.* 




  





 We are looking for a responsible and proactive Finance Manager with substantial expertise in accounting. You thrive in an entrepreneurial organization with a fast-paced environment and diverse responsibilities. As a Finance manager, you will be offered a role in an international company, registered in Sweden with HQ in Stockholm. You will be experiencing an exciting growth phase, entailing significant influence and involvement in various forward-looking processes.
 



  





 This is a new position where you will be responsible for the Swedish finance department. You will set routines and processes to secure quality and efficiency in the finance team and work closely with the management. You are expected to support the CEO in financial decisions and strategic initiatives, but also works hands-on with financial reporting.
 



  





 As a Finance Manager, you will initially be responsible for a team with 2 direct reports and you have the opportunity to grow the team further. You will be part of the management team and report to the CEO, with a dotted line to the European CFO.
 



  





**Primary responsibilities include:** 



* Financial Strategy: Develop and execute the financial strategy aligned with the company's short-term and long-term goals for the B2B segments.
* Team Building: Establish and lead the finance team, recruiting top talent, fostering a collaborative environment, and providing leadership and mentorship.
* Operational Finance: Oversee all financial operations, including budgeting, accounting, forecasting, financial reporting, cash-flow management, and risk assessment.
* Process Development: Create and implement robust financial processes, policies, and procedures to streamline operations and support growth objectives.
* Define and monitor financial KPIs to measure performance, drive improvements, and support strategic decision-making.
* Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate cross-functionally with leadership teams to align financial strategies with overall business objectives and provide insights for informed decision-making.
* Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, manage financial risks, and oversee audits and reporting.



  





**Your Profile:** 




 You have solid experience in accounting and extensive knowledge of Swedish financial laws, regulations, and compliance standards. You are proactive, self-driven, capable of independently driving the work forward, and can assume the role with overall responsibility for the finance department.
 



  





**Requirements/Qualifications:** 



* Experience in building and leading financial teams from scratch
* Comprehensive knowledge of financial management, accounting, reporting, budgeting, and forecasting
* Ability to create and implement financial systems, processes, and KPIs aligned with company objectives
* Strong strategic thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
* Minimum a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**It a plus if you have experience in the insurance industry** 




**Benefits:** 



* Opportunity to build and shape the company's finance team and strategy from the ground up
* Comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare, retirement plans, and more
* Collaborative and innovative work culture with opportunities for growth and professional development
* The office is centrally located in Stockholm



  





 Selection and interviews will be held on an ongoing basis. The recruitment process includes tests and background checks.
 



  





 We are looking forward to your application!
 



  





**About Howden Insurance Brokers** 




  





 Howden Insurance Brokers is one of the largest insurance groups in the world with 18,000 employees spread across 50 countries. From the beginning, the driving motivation was to build a great company that’s owned by the people who work for it. This employee ownership model is what sets Howden apart. It’s the bedrock of the company culture, and the reason we’ve grown year-on-year since landing the first client back in 1994. The Swedish business celebrate 20 years’ this year and have strong ambitions for the future. We have reached a turnover of SEK 80 million and over the past 2 years we have invested in our teams and grown from 25 to over 50 employees (based in Stockholm (HQ), Gothenburg and Malmö). The plan is to continue growing , doubling the size organically in the next few years
 



  





**Learn more about Howden here.**

title: Business Controller till Henkel
description:
Nu finns möjligheten att bli en del av Henkel i rollen som Business Controller. Här blir du en del av en global aktör känd för innovation och hög kvalitet. Med sina välkända varumärken och toppmoderna teknologier kommer du att ha en central roll i att främja affärstillväxten i Norden!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Henkel Norden Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kontoret är placerat i fina lokaler i Sundbyberg
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Ekonomi/juridik/inköp
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Henkel, som är ledande inom både industri- och konsumentsektorn, är en global aktör med över 50 000 pionjärer som trivs med att "utmana normen". Med välkända varumärken, banbrytande teknik och kreativa lösningar erbjuder Henkel möjligheter att utforska nya vägar och utveckla dina färdigheter.
   

**Som Business Controller**
 kommer du att stödja Henkels växande division Consumer Brands i Norden, med välkända varumärken så som Barnängen, Schwarzkopf, Igora och Osis.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Aktivt stödja det nordiska teamet i att driva affärsutveckling och uppnå mål, som en nyckelmedlem i SBU:s ledningsgrupp.
  
* Tillhandahålla detaljerade finansiella analyser, för att proaktivt lyfta fram risker och möjligheter med ett finansiellt perspektiv på den ekonomiska inverkan.
  
* Utveckla en god förståelse för varumärke, marknad och kategoriprestanda, samt tillhandahålla analyser som hjälper till att leverera den kort- och långsiktiga affärsstrategin.
  
* Arbeta nära organisationen för Cluster North (Norden & UK/Irland) och rapportera till Head of Controlling.
  
* Säkerställa snabb och tillförlitlig rapportering för den tilldelade affärsenheten, genom att följa månatliga stängnings- och rapporteringsdeadlines.
  
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av Henkels företagsstandarder och relevanta lagar och förordningar.
  
* Bli en del av en dynamisk global organisation med möjligheter till karriärutveckling regionalt och globalt.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning i ekonomi och/eller redovisning.
  
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av Business Controlling eller Financial Planning & Analys.
  
* Starka IT-kunskaper (Excel, BI-verktyg); SAP-kunskap är ett plus.
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, eftersom att du kommer att använda dig av båda språken i ditt dagliga arbete. Kunskaper i finska är ett plus.
  


  


 Henkel lägger stor vikt vid mångfald och inkludering och välkomnar medarbetare med olika bakgrunder, perspektiv och livserfarenheter. Företaget anser att deras styrka ligger i de unika egenskaper som varje individ bidrar med. I denna rekryteringsprocess kommer vi, förutom dina kvalifikationer, att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen. För att trivas i denna roll bör du visa på starka organisatoriska färdigheter, ett skarpt analytiskt tankesätt och utmärkt kommunikationsförmåga. Dessutom tror vi att du tycker om att arbeta i en mångsidig, internationell organisation och samarbeta med intressenter över hela Europa. Vidare tror vi att du är ambitiös och kan självständigt driva projekt.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work. Vi som är ansvariga för denna rekryteringsprocess är Milly ( milly.weidstam@academicwork.se ) samt Stina ( stina.moby@academicwork.se )
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Henkel Norden Aktiebolag**

 Läs mer om Henkel här: This is Henkel
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Henkel Norden Aktiebolag**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Milly Ellqvist Weidstam eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106060

title: Senior Producer (Project Baxter)
description:
We are hiring for a Senior Producer to join our Project Baxter team, currently in pre-production. You will own and ensure delivery on the product vision, whilst leading and inspiring a diverse team from pre-production to post launch.
   

  

 Project Baxter is a 4 player cooperative action game set in the world of Dungeons & Dragons
 *®* 
 . Inspired by our love of tabletop RPGs and built from the ground up in Unreal Engine 5, we will embrace cutting edge technology to create entertaining and emergent gameplay scenarios.
   

  

*Please note, this role must be based in Stockholm with a minimum of 3 days per week in the office.*
**Responsibilities:**
* Overall ownership of the product vision for Project Baxter; maintaining and updating this throughout the development cycle to reflect changes in scope, technical constraints, emergent work, stakeholder requirements, etc.
* Ensure product vision remains clear to all stakeholders; including development, marketing, publishing, central/support teams, executive staff, external partners, and consumers.
* Provide guidance and direction to ensure a high quality delivery of the product vision to all relevant teams and individuals.
* Collaborate with the team to help scope the game to keep it on time, on budget and high quality.
* Collaborate with craft leaders to build and inspire a high functioning team.
* Define quality best practices and standards for the team and ensure adherence to them, setting delivery goals that prioritize the quality of the work and overall product.
* Work with Quality Assurance to quantify and qualify the quality of the product at each milestone.
* Represent your product and franchise by actively participating in multi-year tactical and strategic product business planning.
* Partner with Analytics and Product Owners to ensure key KPIs are defined and monitored, and drive product and development directions using these.
* Build, foster and grow partnerships with externals; including first parties, licensors, and associates parties.
* Build, foster and grow partnerships with internal service and central teams; including Publishing, Marketing, QA, and Studio management and leadership groups.


**Must have:**
* Extensive experience as a Producer on AAA console projects.
* Experience building high-functioning, quality-driven teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication, multi-tasking, and scheduling skills.
* Strong time management skills with the ability to multitask across disciplines, assess risk, define priorities, and resolve problems while meeting deadlines.
* Deep knowledge of game development; including team dynamics, common development hurdles, game engines, development milestones, etc.
* Strong working knowledge of at least one bug-tracking software solution and MS Office.
* Player first mentality.


**Good to have:**
* Experience with online multiplayer live service games.
* Familiarity with Agile and other traditional project management methodologies.
* Hands-on development experience in any development area; art, design, programming, QA, etc.


**Still reading? Good, because here’s the best part:**
 We offer you a position at a company where we value empowerment, agility and ownership. While we evolve we want you to grow with us and to develop as a professional.
   

  

**What more do we offer?**
* Competitive salaries with annual reviews
* Private medical insurance
* Annual wellness benefit
* Referral bonuses
* Long term incentive bonus scheme
* Pension on top of salary (≈50% above collective agreement standard for Sweden employees)
* Relocation support if you move from abroad to Stockholm
* Ideal office location in central Stockholm
* Massage sessions once a month in the Stockholm office


 Sounds good? Then we can’t wait to see your CV and look forward to meeting you. We recommend that you apply as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continuously. Please submit your CV and cover letter in English.
   

  

*Starbreeze values diversity and inclusion, and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome you as who you are, no matter where you are from or what games you play. If there are preparations or accommodations that we can make to help ensure that you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.*
*Recruitment agencies may not submit CVs through this website or directly to hiring managers. Starbreeze Entertainment does not accept unsolicited recruitment agency CVs, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with us.*

title: Systemförvaltare FSM till Presto
description:
Brinner du för att hantera affärsprocesser och säkerställa optimal användning i Prestos koncerngemensamma Field Servie Manamgement system? Presto är inne på en spännande tillväxtresa där man rullar ut systemet i nya länder och söker dig som vill vara med och sätta din prägel. Missa inte chansen – ansök till rollen som Systemförvaltare FSM idag!
   

  

 Din vardag
   

  

 Som systemförvaltare FSM på Presto kommer du säkerställa att ITIL processer följs och vara delaktig i att förverkliga inkommande krav genom dialog med utvecklare och leverantörer. Du kommer att ansvara för att utföra och följa upp tester, hantera utgivningar och säkerställa att systemet fungerar optimalt. Prestos FSM, IFS är koncerngemensamt och du kommer ha kontakt med Prestos verksamheter både i Norden och Europa.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Stödja verksamheten i deras behov av utveckling i systemet
* Utveckla och underhålla systemdokumentation
* Upprätthålla och vidareutveckla processen för utrullning och migration
* Ansvara över att beställa förbättringar från leverantören


 Du kommer jobba nära övriga systemförvaltare i teamet och bli en del av Group IT samt rapportera till chefen för System Management. Vi sitter på helt nyrenoverande kontor centralt i Stockholm och delvist distansarbete är möjligt.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har tidigare erfarenhet från liknande roll som gett god erfarenhet av Field Service Management system och dess processer samt en god förmåga att förstå affärsprocesser och snabbt kunna navigera mellan dem när det kommer till IT-lösningar. Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och har lätt för att se och kunna föreslå effektiviseringar i befintliga lösningar i systemet.
   

  

 Krav:
   

  

* Relevant teknisk utbildning inom data/it eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Tidigare erfarenhet från fältserviceverksamhet och FSM verktyg
* Ett par års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som gett god förståelse för design och krav på integrationer samt applikationshantering
* God förståelse för ITIL-processer
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat med IFS som FSM system och SQL kunskap.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Presto AB grundades 1959 och är Europas ledande aktör med ett heltäckande erbjudande inom brandskydd, första hjälpen och säkerhetsutbildning. Vår vision är att tillsammans med våra kunder rädda liv. Som medarbetare på Presto gör du skillnad. Vi som jobbar på Presto har olika bakgrund och erfarenhet, men gemensamt för alla är en drivkraft att växa och att arbeta tillsammans som ett lag. Vi letar efter dig med rätt inställning och en ambition att utvecklas!
   

  

**Ansökan & kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Presto med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Anja Widell på anja.widell@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Supply Chain & Operations Manager Sweden
description:
**Do you want to help solve complex Supply Chain problems to position our clients for sustainable growth while remaining resilient in times of change?**
 We are experiencing heavy growth and are searching for an excellent business-driven
 **Manager** 
 with experience and interest in
 **Supply Chain and Operations** 
 . You will be part of a leading Nordic Supply Chain and Operations team, working on creating customer centric, resilient, and sustainable supply chains for clients across the Nordics. If you want to help solve complex problems, manage key stakeholders, and help design the supply chains of the future, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**What´s in it for you:**
- Competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, pension, health insurance, employee stock purchase program etc.

- Flexible workload – you have control over your everyday life

- Possibility to specialize and build expertise within supply chain topics through our trainings and specialization program

- Work in a team dedicated to complex problem solving within supply chain and operations, working in a range of industries and projects

- Work alongside leading Nordic and global subject matter experts

**What you will do:**
- Address the needs of Supply Chain Officers and help them make strategic and operational Supply Chain decisions through value driven recommendations

- Provide expertise and insights to our clients to help them build the strategic roadmap for their transformation agendas

- Engage in transformation work ranging from operations optimization to technology-driven business transformation

- Design and improve processes and organizations to position the Supply Chain as a growth enabler

- Contribute to develop our Supply Chain and Operations practice’s assets and knowledge repository

- Mentor junior members of the Strategy & Consulting team and coach them for more responsibility and impact

**To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**
- 5–10 years of working experience from Supply Chain Management, preferably as Management Consultant or from operational improvement projects in large organizations

- A passion for Supply Chain Management / Operations, Logistics / Transportation, Sourcing and Procurement, and an understanding of Operating Models and Process improvement

- An ability to identify and pursue new business opportunities by teaming up with relevant colleagues, and lead and contribute to proposal work to build a pipeline of relevant client work for the SC&O practice

- Experience from collaborating with larger, diverse project teams, bringing the Supply Chain & Operations aspect, and can work creatively in a problem-solving environment

- An ability to communicate effectively and can put ideas and findings into the right context and to the right audience, both written and verbally

- A Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. Logistics, Engineering or Business

- You can travel when required, depending on client and project context

**The position will report to the Supply Chain & Operations Lead in Sweden. The home office can be either in Gothenburg or Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Interested?**
**Apply as soon as possible** 
 by attaching your
 **CV, cover letter and your educational documents including grades** 
 .
 **Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response time might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after.**
 If you have any questions concerning the role or the recruiting process, please contact Magnus Wigernäs +46 76 767 2134, Senior Recruiting Specialist Strategy & Consulting Nordics
   

  

**About Supply Chain And Operations**
 Accenture’s Supply Chain & Operations team is a world leading practice with a local presence in the Nordics and Norway. We are a part of Accenture Strategy & Consulting and focuses on key topics for CEOs, COOs, Supply Chain and Procurement Chief Officers.
   

  

 We help our clients imagine and transform tomorrow’s supply chains and operations to positively impact business, society, and the planet. Our work includes optimizing and establishing flexible operations that enable rapid response to changing customer demands and market opportunities. Strategy, technology, analytics and solid execution are at the core of our efforts to future-proof Supply Chains that deliver on the promise of a better and more sustainable world.
   

  

**About Accenture**
**Accenture** 
 is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. With more than 740,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

title: SAP S/4 Consultant, Order To Cash - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Vill du vara en del av ett snabbt växande globalt team med all sin karriärpotential och bidra till att nå våra tillväxtmål? Om svaret är ja, har vi en perfekt roll för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren SAP Order To Cash (O2C) konsult till vårt team. I rollen har personen som vi söker helst god förståelse för lösningar inkl. SAP-konfiguration, och -anpassning samt dokumentation och testning inom S/4HANA O2C. Erfarenhet av andra moduler som MM anses vara meriterande.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder en fantastisk möjlighet att lära sig och växa med utmanande kundcase hos oss på Tietoevry som är ett av de ledande företagen inom SAP-verksamhet i Norden. Vi vill främja kreativitet så att du kan komma med dina idéer och påverka vår verksamhetsexpansion. I denna tjänst, och i Tietoevry i allmänhet, får du arbeta i en global miljö med professionella kollegor. Vi arbetar i nära samarbete med våra globala nordiska kunder inom detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Designa och implementera SAP Best Practices inom SAP SD och Order To Cash processer
* Arbeta nära intressenter för att förstå och tillhandahålla verksamhetskrav- och funktionsspecifikationer.
* Applikationssupport för SAP O2C-området
* Delta i kundworkshops


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Beprövad erfarenhet som SAP O2C-konsult inom systemkonfigurering.
* God förståelse för O2C-processer
* Utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga för att lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställt inför.
* Förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete.


**Språk:**
* Utmärkt kommunikations- och presentationsförmåga på svenska och engelska (andra språk är meriterande)


**Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:**
 Vi erbjuder dig spännande och utvecklande projekt som ger dig möjlighet att arbeta inom olika branscher så som detaljhandel, tillverkning och skogsindustri. Du får skapa framtiden med oss i en växande och snabbt utvecklande sektor. Som leverantör av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster tror vi på att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att möjliggöra din framgång. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter en öppen kultur där vi trivs med att jobba och utvecklas tillsammans i team och våra konsulter utvecklar i projekten sina individuella färdigheter. Vi använder en flexibel hybridarbetsmodell som en del av vårt arbetssätt. På Tietoevry strävar vi efter ett öppet klimat där vi lägger stor vikt vid att se nyfikenhet och lärandet som en viktig del av arbetslivet.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
 Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
*Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*
**Om Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att skapa en digital framtid där vi, konsultbolag, våra konsulter och kunder går igenom en betydlig transformation.
   

  

 Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör.
   

  

 Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott

title: Nordic Health, Safety & Environmental Manager
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelez International?**
**Join our mission to change the way the world snacks. Make It with Pride.**
 As our expert within Work Environment Management and Health, Safety & Environment (HSE), you take pride in your work and drive the cultural development regarding work environment, health and safety. Your proactive and strategic work will lead the Nordics Office locations (Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland) to become the best workplaces, with healthy employees, zero incidents and accidents.
   

  

 Since this role is within our business unit (including field sales) much focus will be on making sure we meet the relevant standards and regulations, according to local legislation, within organizational and social work environment.
   

  

 In addition, you will also be responsible for coordinating and overseeing implementation of all internal MondelezHSE standards, programs, processes and internal HSE initiatives.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
* Provide work environment and HSE expertise for the four locations, for all new projects/initiatives and change management activities.
* Practively contribute to HSE programs/initiatives (local/MEU programs/initiatives, requests from HSE Commercial Lead, country management requests etc
* Plan for and conduct trainings, coach and inform our leaders and their teams to create awareness and to drive a healthy and "zero accident/incident free culture"
* Ensure local legislation and standards are well understood and compliant with both country specific legislation as well as company regulations.
* Participate in investigations, follow up on identified non-conformances, facilitate closure of these and develops the systems to resolve them based on root cause analysis.
* Ensure appropriate risk assessments are conducted and follow ups are implemented to minimize or eliminate accidents, that might cause harm to anyone at our company location or within field sales.


**What you will bring:**
 A proactive approach and a desire to drive your future and accelerate your career with experience and knowledge in:
   

  

* Deep knowledge of Swedish work environment legislation and preferably in one more of the countries for which you will be working for.
* A relevant university degree within HR, HSE or equivalent training and experience that the Mondelēz deems equivalent. Preferably also a certification within HSE (Nebosh or equivalent).
* Several years of experience working with Systematic Work Environment Management (SAM) and HSE.
* Very good verbal and written communication skills in Swedish, English and preferably one more language, spoken in the countries you will be working for.
* An ability to inspire and cooperate with others at all levels, both internally and externally.
* Maybe write in full eg "Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) in a more generic way. It is part of our standards however key to have/do.
* Ensuring all First aid kit/Fire Extinguishers/Evac chairs/sprinkler system etc and other HSE related materials are frequently checked & updated/maintained according the frequency set
* Make all Permits to Work for all suppliers, not only FM supplier suppliers but also Mondelez International
* (Pro-)actively contribute to HSE programs/initiatives (local/MEU programs/initiatives, requests from HSE Commercial Lead, country management requests etc
* Pro-actively drive the HSE improvement agenda for the office, the Field Force and their teams


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
 The responsibilities of this position are performed within the framework of a regional business model that is defined and managed by Mondelēz Europe GmbH, Switzerland .
   

  

 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 At Mondelez Europe, we are proud, not only of the iconic brands we make, but also of the people who make them. Our delicious products are created in 52 plants across Europe by more than 28,000 passionate people. We are the top maker of chocolate and biscuits and a leading maker of gum and candy. We make sure our powerful global brands and local jewels like Cadbury, Milka and Alpen Gold chocolates, Oreo, belVita, LU and Tuc biscuits get safely into our customers hands—and mouths. Great people and great brands. That’s who we are. Join us on our journey to continue leading the future of snacking around the world by offering the right snack, for the right moment, made the right way.
   

  

 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Health, Safety & Environment
   

  

 Manufacturing

title: Manager, Analytics & Insights (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (RELOCATION PROVIDED)**
 Location of this job: Bangkok, Thailand (\*Not open for remote working.)
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The role sits within the Analytics team under Supply department, where new business ideas, and partnership types are incubated and scaled. This is a broad scoped role, suited to those with a track record of leading small analytics function and/or creating new and high impact business verticals from scratch, from a consulting, sales or business development background with a strong entrepreneurial mindset. You will be expected to perform opportunity sizing on new business opportunities, build high level business cases to justify your proposals and work closely with Product teams to build out new features and functionalities prior to dealing directly with external partners to negotiate and close deals.
   

  

 We are seeking a Manager, Analytics & Insights, to lead strategic and operational initiatives that create both growth and efficiency for the Supply department. In this role, you will work directly with multiple stakeholders, including executive leadership and various cross-functional departments to successfully implement key initiatives. You will impact Agoda’s business through exploring new business opportunities, analyzing complex scaling challenges, and improve existing operations.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
**In this Role, you’ll get to:**
* General: This role is a blend of hands on ‘in the business’ and executive level ‘on the business’ work. To succeed you will enjoy rolling up your sleeves, leading a team and contributing to strategy
* Project Delivery: Manage, standardize & validate the structure of business cases for product development, headcount, engineering resources, budgets, general strategic & roadmap prioritization
* Experimentation: Define success, measure / validate experiments and help ingrain an experimental mindset within the teams
* Forecasting and Insights: Provide a macro-led business intelligence view to the organization to prevent missed opportunities, surmount obstacles at all organizational levels and drive commercial behaviors
* Analytics & Alerts: Quantitative analysis, data mining and presentation of business metrics; identify drivers and build an end-to-end communication framework based on business value, effort and urgency
* Process Improvement: Work with all teams to drive inter- and intra- departmental efficiencies, optimize processes and prioritize system enhancements
* Reporting: Build dashboards, internal / external reports and present key datasets to enable all team members to efficiently and effectively monitor performance and prioritize their efforts
* Leadership: Lead a small team of experts to deliver the above functions and be excited by the challenge of mentoring team members across the chain and connectivity teams


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* 5+ years of leadership experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy
* 2+ years’ experience leading analytics, operational, product or other technical teams
* Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, Python, R, or similar
* Strong statistical modelling and machine learning knowledge
* Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
* Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources
* Strong program/project management experience
* Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
* Experience in articulating strategic issues and negotiating with C-level executives – experience in leading strategy consulting projects a plus
* People management – track record of developing stars
* Ability and willingness to drive projects independently, working efficiently to deliver results rapidly and engaging the relevant stakeholders throughout the process


**It’s Great if you Have:**
* Master’s degree in statistics, economics, mathematics or similar discipline
* Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
* Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience

title: Butikschef till Arken Zoo Mörby Centrum
description:
*Arken Zoo är en rikstäckande kedja inom zoobutiksbranschen som driver franchise och centralägda butiker. Företaget har vuxit snabbt de senaste åren och vi fortsätter att expandera och varumärket Arken Zoo stärks kontinuerligt. I våra butiker har vi ett noga utvalt sortiment till många olika typer av husdjur. Vi älskar djur och våra kärnvärden är kärlek, kunskap och kvalitet.*
**Om anställningen**
 Du erbjuds en tillsvidaretjänst på heltid i ett lönsamt och snabbt växande företag. Tjänsten är förlagd till en Arken Zoos butik i Mörby Centrum.
   

  

* Tjänsten är på heltid, 38,25h/vecka.
* Anställningsavtal och lön mm. enligt överenskommelse.
* Arbetstider, dag, kväll och helg efter schema.
* Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Tjänsten innebär bland annat:
   

  

* Att du ger bästa kundservice varje gång du jobbar och att alltid hjälpa kunden till rätt val av produkt.
* Att du är en driven säljare som älskar mötet med kunden.
* Butiksskötsel, underhåll, uppackning, påfyllning och försäljning.


**Butikschefsrollen innebär bland annat:**
* Aktivt arbetar i butiken tillsammans med din personal
* Har personal- och resultatansvar för butiken
* Ansvarar för att butiken är attraktiv och säljande
* Ansvarar för att våra kunder är nöjda
* Utvecklar medarbetarna i deras roller


**Kvalifikationer:**
 Vi söker dig som har en passion för husdjur, särskilt hund och katt. Du ska vara en utpräglad servicemänniska och ha en viss erfarenhet av butiksarbete och försäljning inom detalj- eller dagligvaruhandeln.
   

  

 Djurvårdsutbildning från gymnasiet, djurparker etc. är en merit men inget krav.
   

  

* Erfarenhet av ledande befattning från detalj- eller dagligvaruhandel är ett krav då det krävs stora kunskaper i affärsmannaskap, personalledning och butiksdrift.
* Ledarskap, erfarenheter av att leda och utveckla säljande personal mot kvalitativa- och kvantitativa mål.
* Schemaläggning, erfarenhet av praktiskt schemaläggningsarbete i t ex webbaserat program
* Grundläggande IT-kunskaper


**Så här söker du tjänsten**
 Klicka på "Skicka ansökan", fyll i formuläret och ladda upp dina ansökningshandlingar.
   

  

 Då urvalet sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar din ansökan snarast. Observera att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller ansökningsprocessen, vänligen kontakta regionchef Caroline Lindholm på caroline.lindholm@arkenzoo.se
   

  

 Observera att ansökningshandlingar endast kan skickas via "Skicka ansökan"-funktionen.
 **Inskickade ansökningar via e-mail kan ej behandlas.**
 Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-09-30
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Arken Zoo grundades 1987 och är Sveriges största detaljhandelskedja för husdjursprodukter, med ca 115 butiker runt om I landet. Sedan 2015 ingår Arken Zoo i Musti Group, med totalt nästan 250 butiker i Norden.
   

  

 Genom våra fysiska butiker, veterinärkliniker, hundfrisörsalonger och e-handel erbjuder vi ett brett och prisvärt sortiment med produkter och tjänster av högsta kvalitet för ditt husdjur.
   

  

 Viktigare än vår storlek är vår vision om att göra livet enklare, säkrare och roligare – för husdjur, hussar och mattar.
   

  

 Välkommen till Arken Zoo. Vi älskar djur. Djur älskar oss.

title: PPC Manager - Swedish Speaking
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
**We're looking for a talented PPC Specialist to join our team and manage campaigns for our one of our exciting casino and sportsbook brands in Sweden!
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone with a strong foundation in PPC fundamentals who is eager to dive into the dynamic world of online casino and sportsbook.**
**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**
* Prepare go-to-market strategies of our best brands in regulated markets
* Daily execution of Paid Search campaigns with a focus on identifying new opportunities of growth across our biggest markets and accounts.
* Manage, optimise & maximise the company's ROI on Google Ads & Bing Ads (Search) with minimal management.
* Provide budget planning, regular reporting and analysis of campaign performance to key stakeholders like Country & Marketing Managers
* Improve conversions by a/b testing different variables
* Proactively maintain high levels of up-to-date knowledge of best practices and strategies for Paid Search in the organisation and apply in the business where applicable
* Work closely together with SEO, Content and CRO team to increase relevancy and conversion rate for Paid Search campaigns


**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:**
* Fluent in written and spoken English and Swedish.
* 1+ years of experience working in a similar role, ideally within the gaming industry.
* Advanced knowledge of Google Ads, Bing Ads, Editor and keyword research tools. Additional experience using value-based bidding is considered a plus.
* Intermediate to advanced experience using Google Analytics. Google Analytics 4 Certification would be ideal.
* Exceptional analytical skills, being able to extract meaning and insights from large amounts of data and make recommendations based on it.
* Knowledge of conversion tracking and attribution modeling
* Experience in PPC automation tools and scripts
* You are highly proactive, well-organised, analytical and have excellent Excel skills.


**WHO ARE WE?**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C Apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights


**JOIN US!**
 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Do you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Social Media Manager - Swedish Market
description:

*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Focusing on Sports and Casino, the Social Media Manager will be at the forefront of our Swedish social media strategy, creating market-specific plans, tailoring content for Sweden and driving initiatives to meet and exceed key performance indicators (KPIs).
   

  

 This role requires a resourceful, creative, and passionate person who can harness their direct experience in managing social media channels and digital campaigns.
   

  

 You must have excellent creative, written and communication skills, with the ability to create, plan and prioritise. The ideal candidate will be flexible and self-motivated whilst being able to multi-task, and adaptable.

 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. title: Head of Loan Syndication & Sales, LC&FI | SEB, Stockholm/London
description:
SEB is a leading international financial services group with Large & Medium sized Corporates, Sponsors and Financial Institutions as core customers. We are consistently recognised for our expertise and customer-centric approach, which we achieve by strong customer focus, committing to quality and trust, and encouraging an entrepreneurial mindset in everything we do.
   

  

 We are currently on the lookout for a team Head of the recently formed Loan Syndicate & Sales (LSS) team, which was established on the back of the re-org within the Debt IB UK organisation. This placement can be either in Stockholm or London.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The LSS team focuses on the primary and secondary syndication and distribution of Leveraged, Infrastructure and Corporate Loans. The team is a key part of SEB’s originate to distribute strategy with responsibility for structuring, pricing, and selling best effort and underwritten transactions.
   

  

 As Head of the team your area of responsibility from a Syndicate perspective will be to participate in all aspects of the team’s underwriting, distribution and advisory activities. Additionally, you would be expected to drive the syndication process including engaging with the investor community on live transactions, co-ordinating with syndicate banks and updating issuers.
   

  

 The role also envisages engaging in the loan distribution part of the value chain, including taking responsibility for an allocated investor base and developing the team’s distribution footprint in relevant areas. Main investor groups being UK-based, Nordic, German and broader International institutional investors, banks, as well as private credit providers.
   

  

 As a manager you will lead an ambitious and high-performing team of individuals across geographies, where you are expected to coach, engage and develop the group, whilst promoting an inclusive and interactive work culture.
   

  

**Who Are We Looking For**
 We are looking for an individual with minimum ten years relevant work experience, ideally from Loan and Bond syndication or origination, and with a good understanding of capital markets and the primary syndication process. Any structuring and pricing skills and good knowledge of the distribution part of the value chain and secondary market dynamics will be highly beneficial. Moreover, you will have a proven track record of successfully leading a team, where a people-oriented and engaging approach to building sustainable teams is highly desired.
   

  

 The job is highly team-oriented and in order to be successful you need to be a strong team player who operates effectively in a large organisation; comfortable in a multi-cultural international environment, and with strong communication skills.
   

  

 You will need to be able to prioritise and deal with multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment and enjoy responsibility as you lead the strategic direction of the business as a whole.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 SEB offers an attractive and international learning environment. We aim to attract exceptional individuals with a desire to grow their own skillset as well as provide exceptional service to their clients. You will work side by side with a diverse team of experienced colleagues and get the chance to build strong network internally as well as externally.
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe and where they come from.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

**Application details**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and why you believe this position is right for you. Candidates will be reviewed and selected on an ongoing basis, and you are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 2 August 2024 . Should you have any questions regarding the position you can reach out to Carlo Lugani, on carlo.lugani@seb.se or Joakim Isaksson, Talent Acquisition Partner, on joakim.isaksson@seb.se . We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Chefsjurist
description:
Vi välkomnar en Chefsjurist till vår ledningsgrupp! Att beskriva uppdraget är enkelt – du är övergripande ansvarig för bolagets juridiska frågeställningar. Att leverera på uppdraget? Det hoppas vi att du ser som en rolig nästa utmaning för dig!
   

  

 Kronans Apotek har under de senaste två åren genomgått en stor förändringsresa där vi slogs samman med den tidigare aktören Apoteksgruppen, och idag är vi Sveriges största apotekskedja med 500 apotek runt om i hela landet och en växande e-handel. Vi är drygt 4000 kollegor som dagligen möter 80 000 kunder. Relevant för denna roll är att vi står inför en legal merger under slutet på detta år, något som du kommer arbeta intensivt med i början av din tid hos oss.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden och arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Chefsjurist ansvarar du för att leda och effektivisera bolagets juridiska arbete, du är experten på området, en naturlig rådgivande och utmanande funktion, och stöttar bolaget med juridiska underlag och utredningar. Vidare kontrollerar du bolagets lag- och regelefterlevnad inom branschen, alltid med en stor förståelse för affären. I rollen ingår bland annat följande ansvarsområden och arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

  

* Proaktivt arbeta för att en rimlig nivå av juridisk kompetens ska finnas på bolaget och därigenom effektivisera bolagets juridiska processer
* Besitta kunskap inom för bolaget relevanta rättsområden
* Stöd vid försäkringsärenden inom bolaget
* Kommunicera med ledning, ägare, myndigheter och andra nyckelpersoner kring juridiska uppdateringar och händelser
* Bistå vid förhandlingar och upprättande av avtal inom bolaget
* Säkerställa att bolagets juristfunktion supporterar bolagets anställda i dataskyddsfrågor i syfte att säkerställa att GDPR efterlevs inom bolaget
* Personalansvar för bolagets jurister som i dagsläget är fem kollegor


 Du välkomnas till vår ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till CEO, Tomas Rupšys. I ledningsgruppen finns också ekonomi, försäljning (e-handel och butik), marknad, HR, IT och kvalitet och hållbarhet representerade och tillsammans ansvarar ni för bolagets övergripande strategi och att vi tar de kliv på marknaden vi planerar att göra.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av affärsjuridik och en liknande roll, gärna inom detaljhandel eller bransch med liknande juridiska utmaningar. För att trivas hos oss behöver du som person vara väldigt hands-on och må bra i en miljö där är beredd att kavla upp ärmarna, för även om rollen är strategisk kommer det att krävas där vi befinner oss. Vi är också övertygade om att flexibilitet, noggrannhet och proaktivitet ligger i din natur. Delar du dessutom vår bild av att vi är som bäst när vi är nyfikna, tar ansvar och arbetar tillsammans – kommer du trivas som fisken i vattnet.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 I ansökningsformuläret ber vi dig bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil på engelska, då vår CEO är engelskspråkig. Personligt brev? Det kan du skippa! Som förespråkare av objektiv rekrytering vill vi lära känna dig som matchar erfarenhetsmässigt vid en intervju. Ansökningar och eventuella frågor om denna tjänst kommer att hanteras först v. 32, då vi är på lite välförtjänt semester. Sista ansökningsdag är 4 augusti 2024. Frågor mailas till Sofia.Lindqvist@apoteksgruppen.se, som är Head of Talent Acquisition hos oss.
   

  

 Vi önskar en fortsatt fin sommar och varmt välkommen med din ansökan! 👑
   

  

*Vår vision är en värld som mår bra, och du kan hjälpa oss att göra den visionen verklig. Vi tror att meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, starka teamrelationer och en generös dos skratt skapar en arbetsmiljö som inspirerar och stärker oss och alla våra kunder. Med fokus på både här och nu, samt på framtiden - bidrar vi tillsammans till en värld som mår bra!*

title: Tax Director
description:
Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.
   

  

 We are currently looking for an experienced
 **Tax Director** 
 to drive the tax strategy for the organization, define procedures and controls to ensure tax compliance.
   

  

 This role is for you if you are seeking a senior position that has global exposure, that is based in company’s HQ, that offers variety of tasks and a chance to work with great colleagues across the globe.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As Tax Director, you will primarily be responsible for areas within corporate income tax, tax accounting and Pillar 2, but you will also be involved in areas such as transfer pricing and indirect taxes for Electrolux Group.
   

  

 You will report to our Head of Group Tax and will be based in Electrolux’s international and dynamic global headquarters in Stockholm.
   

  

**In detail you will:**
* Manage and control the group’s international tax structure and flows while driving digitization, standardization and continuous improvement
* Participate in the ongoing business changes to ensure compliance and best practice approach regarding corporate tax
* Manage and control the group’s tax accounting and effective tax rate
* Lead M&A projects from a tax perspective
* Manage extensive collaboration with other teams to ensure timely, accurate and thorough analysis and follow up of tax issues
* Interpretation and communication of updates in the tax area, including providing recommendations to other functions
* Ensure implementation and periodically follow up of the tax policy of the Electrolux group on a global basis
* Develop strong working relationships with our business area teams and management as well as other Group staff functions


**Who you are:**
* Agile. Both reactive and proactive, you work efficiently and flexibly to deliver results.
* Analytical. With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can also translate this into meaningful, useful information that informs decision-making.
* Collaborative. You ask and you listen, you take ideas on board and work with your team, taking everyone in the same direction.
* Influential. You get to know your stuff and can articulate it well, building a case that is sound and people can buy into.
* A problem-solver. You see a challenge as an opportunity.
* Self-starter. You are keen for new experiences, responsibility and accountability. You are self-driven with a positive outlook and can-do attitude.
* Good listener and communicator. You have great communication skills and you have the ability to convince, influence and motivate others in a complex matrix organization


**Key Requirements:**
* Minimum 8 years of experience working with corporate tax at a multinational company and/or as a consultant
* Master/bachelor degree in law or finance
* Extensive experience in tax management and international tax
* Experience in tax accounting will be an additional advantage
* Ability to solve unstructured tax problems and lead multiple priorities with a little day-to-day direction
* Knowledge of participating in negotiations or dealings with tax authorities is recommended
* Fluent English


**Where you'll be situated:**
 You will be based at our Global headquarters in Stockholm at Sankt Göransgatan 143
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment,
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path,
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services,
* Family and health friendly benefits,
* Insurance policy plan
* Additional holidays


**Find out more:**
 Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux
   

  

 Stockholm HQ: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/sweden

title: Windowsspecialist till Tutus
description:
Tutus arbetar i nationens tjänst för skydd av känslig och sekretessbelagd information. Vi utvecklar krypto och IT säkerhetsprodukter till kunder med höga krav på säkerhet och assurans, bl. a högkvalitativa nätverkskrypteringslösningar åt militär, myndigheter och företag för användning i verksamheter som kräver högsta nivå på säker kommunikation. Våra produkter är godkända på nivån Restricted / Begränsat hemlig för såväl EU som på nationell nivå. Tutus är huvudleverantören av myndighetsgodkända och certifierade IT-säkerhetsprodukter i Sverige och vi gör stadiga framsteg mot målet att bli en ledande leverantör av godkända IT-säkerhetsprodukter också inom EU.
   

  

 Men vi är också ett familjärt bolag med platt organisation under stark tillväxt. Hos oss trivs du om du gillar den kamratliga miljön där egna initiativ och drivkraft uppskattas. Vår verksamhet ställer också krav på våra lokaler, vilket inte gör dom mindre trevliga för det. Alla våra roller utgår till nära 100% från kontoret i Danderyd.
   

  

 Vi söker just nu dig som vill jobba som Windowsspecialist och vill vara en del av det team som jobbar med framtagning samt uppsättning av våra produkter och tjänster. Rollen innebär även att utveckla, designa och kravställa nya produkter och systemlösningar där tyngden ligger på Windows/ Windows Server.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Du blir en del av ett team som jobbar med utveckling och uppsättning av nya produkter och tjänster för säker kommunikation och informationshantering. I denna roll arbetar du både med att utveckla, designa och kravställa produkter och systemlösningar med tyngdpunkt på Windows/Windows Server. Hos oss arbetar vi dock inte med publika cloudtjänster och central styrning, som hos många andra aktörer. Vårt säkerhetstänk genomsyrar allt vi gör får våra kunder som ställer höga krav på ”vattentäta” system.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
**Vi söker dig som har**
* Akademisk examen i relevant område eller motsvarande erfarenhet skaffad på annat sätt
* Kunskap kring Windows på djupet kopplat till säkerhet på klientnivå
* Mycket goda kunskaper och erfarenheter om MS produkter i avgränsad miljö (fristående, on-prem, skiljt från internet)
* Goda kunskaper i powershell
* Högt IT säkerhetstänk
* Intresse för, och gärna erfarenhet av, IT säkerhet på hög nivå.


**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av/kunskap inom**
* Arbete i en miljö med högt ställda krav på IT säkerhet, tex försvaret, polisen eller annan verksamhet med motsvarande krav
* Arbete i en kundorienterad miljö
* Arbete som systemadministratör
* Arbete med härdning av klienter/servrar
* Linux
* Nätverk (Routing, Switch, TCP/IP)


**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Tutus med IDG recruitment. Kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Oscar Nordström för frågor oscar.nordstrom@idg.se eller 0722 522 375.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Danderyd (Mörby Centrum)
   

  

 En anställning hos oss är placerad i säkerhetsklass och
   

  

 säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer därför att genomföras vid
   

  

 anställning i enlighet med 3 kap. säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

**Om Tutus**
*Tutus är ett privatägt svenskt företag, grundat 1992. Sedan dess har de utvecklat högkvalitativa nätverkskrypteringslösningar åt militär, myndigheter och företag för användning i verksamheter som kräver högsta nivå på säker kommunikation.* 
*Som ett oberoende företag samarbetar de med näringsliv och myndigheter för att kunna tillhandahålla pålitliga, säkra och kostnadseffektiva krypteringslösningar som kan möta deras säkerhetsbehov.* 
*Deras produkter är godkända på nivån Restricted / Begränsat hemlig för såväl EU som på nationell nivå.* 
*Tutus är huvudleverantören av myndighetsgodkända och -certifierade IT-säkerhetsprodukter i Sverige och de gör stadiga framsteg mot målet att bli en ledande leverantör av godkända IT-säkerhetsprodukter också inom EU.*

title: Second line support inom cloudtjänster
description:
Flera av våra kunder behöver förstärka sin IT-avdelning inom 2nd line support och Microsoft Azure. Har du erfarenhet inom Windows Server och Cloudtjänster med fokus på Microsoft tjänseutbud? Då är detta något för dig!
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Arbetsuppgifterna kommer bestå av installation, driftsättning, support och felsökning av olika IT-tjänster som Microsoft Azure, Windows servrar och nätverkslösningar. Du kommer att arbeta i företagets 2nd line-gruppering och hantera ärenden som är av mer kvalificerad karaktär och som har eskalerats via 1st line.
