******Observera att svarstiderna kan vara lite längre under sommarmånaderna
 ***då många av oss tar lite ledigt. Vi återkommer till dig så snart vi kan!*******
 🌞**
*Som ett kvalitativt led i våra rekryteringsprocesser kommer en bakgrundskontroll genomföras på slutkandidaten. Vissa roller kräver även annan kontroll, såsom t.ex. säkerhetsprövning, innan uppdrag hos vissa kunder - om det är aktuellt för tjänsten du sökt så kommer du att få mer information kring det i ett senare skede. Ytterligare information finns även på vår hemsida.* 
  

  

 Behandling av personuppgifter | Rejlers
   

  

 Läs mer om din rekryteringsresa och våra olika steg i processen --> här!
   

  

*Vi granskar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**HOME**
 Våra medarbetare är grunden till vår framgång och utveckling. Hos oss ska varje medarbetare känna sig betydelsefull, uppmärksammad och delaktig.
   

  

**LEARNING**
 Våra medarbetares kunskap och erfarenhet helt avgörande för vår framgång och förmåga att utveckla morgondagens hållbara samhälle. Lärandet är med oss hela tiden i allt vi gör – hos oss är man under ständig utveckling!
   

  

**MINDS**
 Med en nyfiken inställning som uppmuntrar och inspirerar till nytänkande, vågar vi utmana både oss själva och vår omgivning. Vi har ett starkt fokus på ett uppmuntrande, tillitsfullt och kommunikativt ledarskap. Lika viktigt är medarbetarskapet där vi alla har ett eget ansvar för lärande och ständig utveckling.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår kultur här: Our Culture | Rejlers

title: Nordic HR & Payroll Coordinator - a brand new position
description:
Are you a proactive and detail-oriented person with excellent organizational and communication skills? Do you thrive in administrative roles where you can take ownership and make a real impact? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 In this newly created role as HR & Payroll Coordinator, you'll be able to contribute to the success of our organization by improving of HR routines, processes and digitization as well as offering valuable support to colleagues and managers.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities:**
* Managing the monthly payroll process, including salary preparation, liaising with external Payroll Agencies in the Nordic countries, and handling approvals and payments. Serving as the primary contact for our external payroll agency in all four Nordic countries.
* Managing company pension plans, employee insurances, benefits, expense reporting, and company cars.
* Ensure compliance with company policies, relevant laws, and regulations.
* Establishing communication channels with national authorities, fleet companies, and external partners in Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden.
* Conducting payroll accounting in SAP across all four countries, managing salary payments, and preparing monthly salary reports.
* Providing monthly HR-related KPI reports to Group and national authorities.
* Prepare and submit payroll-related reports as required by management or regulatory agencies.
* Assist in audits and compliance reviews related to payroll and HR functions.
* Handling HR administration tasks such as preparing certificates, employment contracts, and managing personnel data.
* Support our Managers in the recruitment process from advertising to administration of employment contracts and on-/offboarding processes.
* Assisting the Finance team with various tasks and supporting the Head of HR in annual budget processes and salary reviews.


 In this role you report to the Nordic Head of HR.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be successful in this role you have previous experience in service and/or coordination roles in HR and payroll. Experience in diverse HR processes is essential for success in this role. We also believe that you are/have:
   

  

* Strong understanding of payroll principles, practices, and regulations from the Nordic market.
* Proficient in labor legislation, preferably in Norway, Finland, and Denmark.
* Detail-oriented with the ability to see the big picture, proactive in problem-solving, and skilled in prioritizing tasks.
* Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain confidentiality.
* Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative mindset.
* Strong communication skills. Fluent in both Swedish and English.
* Proficient in using Excel for data management, reporting and analysis. Knowledge in SAP, and are familiar with HR systems such as SuccessFactors or Workday.


 The company is built on true entrepreneurship. This allows the employees to enjoy a high degree of freedom in terms of decision making but at the same time sets high demands on accepting responsibility for the assigned position. It is also fully acknowledged within all parts of the organization that we shape our own future and that this requires an adequate work volume.
   

  

**Does it sound interesting?**
 We hope so! If you're ready to make a meaningful impact and drive sustainability at Lindt Nordic, we encourage you to apply and be a part of our dedicated team. Together, we can create a more sustainable future. You are welcome to submit your application no later than the 31st of July 2024.
   

  

 Interviews are being held ongoing, so please send your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, you are most welcome to Katarina Edlund Holmberg, Head of HR, kedlundholmberg@lindt.com
   

  

**About Lindt** 
 Lindt has enchanted chocolate lovers all over the world since 1845. During the 175 years of Lindt & Sprüngli’s existence, the company has produced chocolate and chocolate related products. Nothing else. Generations of thrilled, imaginative, enthusiastic, and inventive employees have built the company to what it is today: the world’s leading producer of premium chocolate. Within the last 20 years, Lindt has succeeded reshaping the chocolate market in the Nordics. From having been a niche player, Lindt has quickly grown into the leading premium brand in Sweden, and is one of the fastest growing chocolate companies in the rest of the region. In the eyes of the Nordic consumers, Lindt is known for elevating their chocolate consumption with the best quality chocolate.

title: QA Tester
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented QA Tester to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for quality assurance and a keen eye for identifying issues. As a QA Tester, you will be responsible for testing our software products to ensure they meet the highest standards of quality and reliability.

**About the Company**
  

Klaravik SE is a prominent auction brand known for its robust online platform that facilitates the sale of a wide range of items, including machinery, vehicles, equipment, and various industrial tools. Established in Sweden, Klaravik has carved out a reputation for being a reliable and efficient marketplace for both buyers and sellers.
  

  

Klaravik is a part of TBAuctions, a group that encompasses several auction brands under its umbrella, Klaravik benefits from an expansive network and a broad customer base. This integration enhances its capabilities to reach a wider audience, ensuring a constant flow of items and bids, thereby maintaining a dynamic and vibrant auction environment.


**About the Role**  

In this role you will:

* Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using Cypress and JavaScript for web applications.
* Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using tools for mobile app testing, like nodejs, webdriverio and appium.
* Perform comprehensive functional and non-functional testing of our applications, ensuring the highest quality standards. Run feature testing, regression, useability, e-2-e, etc
* Identify, document, and track software defects and inconsistencies.
* Prepare test plans and check-lists.
* Collaborate closely with developers, product managers, sales teams, and support to understand requirements and ensure robust test coverage.
* Conduct risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies.
* Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and contribute to sprint planning and retrospectives.
* Continuously improve the testing processes and frameworks to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in QA automation.
* Monitor swat and support channel to help out with functional issues/misunderstood functionality.
* Create demo videos describing new functionality to all platform users
* Keep test environment stable, ensure test data is in place.

**About You**  

You have several years of experience in similar work. Taking responsibility comes naturally to you, and you know how to balance professional work behavior with having fun at the office.  



**Required Skills and Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a QA Automation Engineer or similar role.
* Proficiency in Cypress and JavaScript.
* Experience with end-to-end testing of web and mobile applications.
* Familiarity with front-end technologies including JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Angular.
* Understanding of back-end development, particularly with Kotlin.
* Knowledge of Azure microservices and cloud-based architectures.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Argo, Jenkins, GitLab, or Azure DevOps.
* Ability to handle stress.

Ability to switch context 100 times a day  
* 

**The ideal candidate:**

* Has experience with other automation tools and frameworks.
* Has knowledge of performance and load testing and/or security testing.
* Has experience in a microservices architecture.
* Is fluent in English

**What we offer**
  

A pleasant workplace in modern premises in central Lund right by the train station. There are also city- and regional buses nearby.


Flexible working hours give you the opportunity to balance your private life and work, no matter where you are in life.


We have 6 weeks of vacation, wellness contribution, pension solution and health insurance.

**Details**
  

Start day: According to agreement
  

Location: Vävaregatan 21, 227 36 Lund
  

Salary: According to agreement
  

  

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Inna Aleshina, Quality Assurance Manager at i.aleshina@tbauctions.com
  

  

We recommend that you submit your application immediately as we make a continuous selection.
  

Looking forward to your application!

title: DevOps Engineer | IKEA Planning Experience (IPEX)
description:
**Job ID:** REF17117N


**Date posted:** 17/07/2024

  

**IKEA is building for the future.**

*The goal of IPEX - IKEA Planning experience is to support and empower customers to find their personal best home furnishing solutions. We run and develop digital solutions used by customers and co-workers enabling them to design homes and home furnishing solutions for the entire IKEA range for all IKEA retailers. Part of our portfolio are planning solutions for Kitchens, Bathrooms, Storage solutions, Beds... Our next big step ahead will be to enable customers to design their full homes.*

*Our customers should experience an inspiring, fun, simple and rewarding planning journey based on their needs and preferences. Our co-workers and service partners should experience a fun, efficient and unbroken sales process.*

*The solutions and capabilities we develop are an integral part of the entire seamless buying and selling experience and a key contributor to converting visitors into happy customers and to engaging with our customers from the start. Utilizing data around and about our products to create more personalized experiences is an integral part of the work we do.*

*IPEX deliver solutions to all IKEA retailers spanning over 60 markets worldwide and over 400 stores and IKEAs digital channels. All solutions are made to help customers and co-workers in all customer meetings, from a mobile phone to the largest IKEA store in the world.*

**Being a DevOps engineer in the IPEX team**  

We are looking for a DevOps engineer that can help us in continuing building a DevOps culture where we automate where it makes sense, implement agile framework to be lean, measure and monitor to gather insights and understandings and where we share our knowledge and competence.


As DevOps engineer, you will work closely together with the product teams at IPEX, focusing on enabling IKEA to produce high-quality services and products, to create a better everyday life for the many people. In this role you will be the ambassador for DevOps and incorporate yourself and support our product teams where needed.


In this role you will work in close cooperation with other parts of Inter IKEA group.

**In the team we are mostly working with the following languages, techniques and frameworks.**

* GitHub Actions
* AWS
* Azure
* Docker
* Infrastructure as Code tooling
* Logging and monitoring tools
* Application and/or cloud security


You are comfortable with communicating and explaining security concerns and topics, to persons with and without solid understanding of information technology. With your excellent communication skills, you have the capability to build strong relations with both internal as external stakeholders.


We see that you have strong motivation in the following areas:

* Energetic, driven and committed to deliver result in a high paced environment
* Pragmatic and solution-oriented team player
* Experienced and motivated in working in a rapidly changing environment
* High entrepreneurial drive: stretching boundaries, challenging what already exists, always striving to develop better products and solutions

**To be successful in this role**


You have a great interest and proven track record in creating great solutions/ experiences for users and you understand how future technologies and trends can improve customer and co-worker experiences throughout the product lifecycle. You have lead tech teams before and bring solid leadership experience.


You enjoy an agile and iterative, yet structured way of working and achieving results together with a team in a flexible environment, but also have a strong individual drive to deliver high quality results on time. You have great communication and networking skills and are fluent in written and spoken English.


Travelling based on business needs might be necessary.

**Is this the challenge for you?**


This role is full-time (40 hours per week) and based in Malmö in Sweden.For this position we are interviewing continuously so please don’t delay with your application in English and don’t forget the cover letter by 31-Jan-24.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Software/DevOps Engineer
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 3+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

Tjänsten som Software Engineer på Data Management and Software Centre (DMSC) i Köpenhamn, Danmark. DMSC har i uppdrag att stödja användare med deras behov av vetenskaplig beräkning, inklusive hårdvara, datainsamling, dataanalys, modellerings- och simuleringsverktyg för experimentplanering och analys.
  
Om teamet Software Engineer kommer att ingå i Experiment Control and Data Curation (ECDC)-gruppen på DMSC. Gruppen är ansvarig för att producera verktyg som används av forskare för att genomföra sina avancerade experiment, med hjälp av våra nästa generations neutronanläggningar.
  
Teamets uppgifter och ansvar inkluderar, men är inte begränsade till:
  
Bygga och stödja hela programvarudatainsamlingskedjan som användare kommer att förlita sig på för sina experiment.
  
Optimera användarupplevelsen för att låta forskarna fokusera på sina vetenskapliga mål.
  
Stödja forskare med deras behov av datainsamling.
  
  

Om rollen Som framgångsrik kandidat kommer du, tillsammans med teamet:
  
Definiera, implementera och stödja datainsamlingspipelinen baserad på Apache Kafka.
  
Utveckla och stödja vårt CI/CD-ramverk och distributionsystem.
  
Utveckla programvara inom ramen för vårt mjukvarusystem för att ge tillgång till alla vetenskapliga möjligheter.
  
Stödja besökande forskare och personal i användningen av hela datainsamlingskedjan och experimentkontrollramverket.
  
Samarbeta med kollegor och andra anläggningar världen över.
  
  

Du kommer att arbeta på plats i Köpenhamn tre dagar i veckan och två dagar på distans.
  
Om dig Du har gedigen programmeringserfarenhet i C++ och/eller Python, samt uppfyller några av följande krav:
  
En examen eller relevant högre kvalifikation inom STEM eller mjukvarurelaterade ämnen.
  
Erfarenhet av insamling, bearbetning eller analys av data.
  
Erfarenhet av dataströmning eller meddelandemäklarsystem, som Apache Kafka.
  
Erfarenhet av att bygga, testa och distribuera programvara med CI/CD-verktyg.
  
Förmåga att effektivt arbeta med Linux-operativsystem.
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta som en del av ett större team eller i samarbete.
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med HDF-filformatet.
  
  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du gillar att kommunicera och samarbeta med människor från olika bakgrunder och expertområden. Du har också förmågan att ta initiativ och njuter av att hitta nya lösningar.
  
Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Data Analyst – Luleå heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en av våra kunders räkning söker vi nu en senior Data Analyst. Vår kund är ett stabilt och tryggt konsultbolag med stark ekonomi. Företaget erbjuder intressanta uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, med fokus på samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar, och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal. Företaget har funnits sedan 2003 och består idag av ett 100-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Luleå. Du kommer även ha möjligheten att arbeta hemifrån.
  
I din roll kommer du att bidra till att skapa nya insikter och främja datadrivet beslutsfattande hos företagets kunder. Företagets kunder står inför utmaningar där de behöver dra nytta av digitaliseringens möjligheter för att effektivisera och automatisera sina verksamheter. Det finns ett ökat behov av kompetens kring avancerad statistisk analys och automation. Du kommer att tillhöra företagets beslutsstödsteam. Teamet jobbar Microsoftorienterat.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
  
har minst 5 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
  
erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
  
erfarenhet av Power BI
  
har en vana av att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
  
har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
  
har goda SQL-kunskaper
  
behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS, kunskap i R eller Python, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS.
  
kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg.
  
  

**Du får:**  

Uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar
  
En anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
  
Balans i livet där det finns plats för både familj och fritid
  
En kompetensresa som är unik för dig och din karriärresa
  
En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och bra förmåner
  
En lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig del och vinstdelning
  
En platt organisation med närhet till ledning och stor delaktighet
  
  

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Senior Data Analyst – Luleå heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

‍ ️ About Redeploy Run
  
  

At Redeploy Run, we specialize in platform engineering and operations, helping our customers simplify their infrastructure and speed up application delivery. Our mission is to make cloud adoption faster and easier.
  
  

Our 'Ready-to-Run' platform products, including Technology Platforms and Industry Cloud Platforms, let IT departments and developers manage infrastructure and governance with ease. Leveraging Infrastructure as Code, container-based services, CI/CD, and Kubernetes, and collaborating with cloud providers like Azure and AWS, we tackle complex problems, enhance our tools, and provide guidance to help customers get the most of their cloud platforms.
  
  

As a rapidly growing cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for both senior and junior Network Security Engineers who want to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?
  
  

✍ About the role
  
  

As Network Security Engineer, you’ll join our Operations team who has a responsibility for ensuring the security and operations of our diverse customers’ network infrastructures across cloud environments (Azure and AWS) and on-premises systems.
  
  

In this role, your focus will be on operations and to implement, manage, and maintain network security measures for multiple customers using Fortigate and Checkpoint solutions. Some of your tasks will amongst others be:
  
  

Designing and managing security protocols and policies for cloud environments.
  
  

Securing on-premises infrastructures, including firewalls and VPNs.
  
  

Monitoring network traffic for unusual activities, analyzing security threats, and responding to incidents.
  
  

Configuring and managing security settings, firewall rules, and VPN connections to ensure optimal performance and security.
  
  

Documenting security configurations, policies, and incidents as well as preparing reports for customers and internal use.
  
  

Diagnosing and resolving network security issues for our customers and providing advice and expertise to resolve any related technical problems.
  
  

Staying updated with the latest security trends, threats and technologies.
  
  

We provide our customers 24/7 support for urgent network security issues and incidents, and you will be part of an on-call rotation scheme and offered extra compensation for your efforts.
  
Who are you?
  
  

We believe you have a keen interest for networking, security and cloud and that you enjoy creating value and solving problems for clients. You are a strong believer in automation, making things faster and have a willingness to continuously learn and adapt to new technologies and security challenges.
  
  

We are looking for several new colleagues to join us - either you are senior with several years commercial experience in the field and are searching for your next challenge, or you just started your career in networking and security and are looking for a place where you can learn the ins and outs of the field by experienced professionals.
  
  

Other than that, we see that you come with following experiences:
  
  

Experience as a Network Security Engineer, with expertise in Fortigate and Checkpoint products.
  
  

Strong knowledge of network protocols, firewall management.
  
  

Experience with cloud networking and security in Azure and AWS environments.
  
  

Familiarity with security best practices, compliance standards, and risk management.
  
  

Experience in automation and DevOps practices.
  
  

Experience and knowledeg of Terraform, Go, Python, Bash, Powershell, or similar to support automation.
  
  

(For juniors we see that you have an education in related field, as well as basic understanding of the mentioned experiences above).
  
  

And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage
  
  

Relevant certifications such as Fortinet NSE, or Checkpoint CCS(X)
  
  

What we offer
  
  

Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.
  
  

Want to learn more about our benefits package? Find more info here: https://careers.redeploy.com/
  
Location
  
  

Our office is located in central Stockholm at Torsgatan 4. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location.
  
  

Ready to join the team?
  
  

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
  
  

We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Head of Redeploy Run Jonas Erikson - Jonas.Erikson@Redeploy.com.
  
  

We look forward hearing from you!

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy. We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Head of Redeploy Run Jonas Erikson - Jonas.Erikson@Redeploy.com.
  
We look forward hearing from you!

title: QA specialist – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en QA specialist. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
  

**Du har utbildning på kandidatnivå och erfarenhet av:**  

Quality assurance
  
Ta fram teststrategier
  
Testautomatisering (minst 1 år)
  
Agila metoder
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Testautomationsverktyg (som Selenium, Cypress, Katalon, Postman, Soap-UI, pytest)
  
CI/CD-verktyg (som Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
ISTQB-certifiering eller andra certifieringar som SAFe, ScrumMaster
  
Versionshantering (som Git)
  
Kunskap inom mordern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som kubernetesplattformar)
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, enligt Great Place to Work 2022!
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”QA specialist – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Metrea Simulations is looking for a DevOps/Build Engineer to join our team and play a key role in shaping our infrastructure. This role will have a big part in designing, developing , and maintaining our environment across a hybrid infrastructure of cloud and on-premise environments as well as our build system. You will work closely with developers, ensuring smooth and efficient delivery of high-quality software.
   

  

 This role will require you to be a team player who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary environment and expects you to be communicative and independent in your work. You should be motivated to find creative and scalable solutions for complex problems.
   

  

**R Esponsibilities Include**
* Design, maintain and configure infrastructure across both public cloud and on-premise environments, including Windows and Linux servers.
* Collaborate with developers and operations teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery.
* Monitor system health and performance, proactively identify and troubleshoot potential issues.
* Support developers in designing, developing, and implementing automated build and deployment pipelines.
* Develop and maintain build system and agents ecosystem


**Requirements**
* Experience with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet.
* Experience with CI/CD tools like TeamCity, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps.
* Experience working with public cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Solid understanding of Windows and Linux server administration.
* Scripting experience with languages like Python, PowerShell or Bash.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.


 Things we think could be useful in this role
   

  

* Passion for anything aerospace-related
* Interest in flight simulation
* Experience working with international teams
* Background in related fields (e.g., Military, Aerospace, Software, Engineering)

title: Platform Engineer
description:
We're recruiting a Platform Engineer for our client in Stockholm!
 



  





 You'll be part of a heavily backed start-up that is developing new cloud services for the European market. As a Platform Engineer, you'll be a key player in designing and building their foundational infrastructure, ensuring speed, reliability and scalability across all engineering teams.
 



 The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of Kubernetes, Linux, and Distributed Systems and good programming experience with languages such as Go, Python or Rust.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, implement, and manage scalable and resilient infrastructure using Kubernetes.
* Write and maintain Golang code for infrastructure tooling and automation.
* Use Terraform to define, build, and maintain infrastructure as code.
* Develop, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines to streamline the deployment process.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning, deployment, and management tasks.



  





**Requirements:** 



* 3+ years of experience in Platform engineering or a similar role.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes in a production environment.
* Strong proficiency in Linux systems administration
* Proven experience with programming, ideally in Go.
* Experience with CI/CD tools and practices.
* Solid understanding of distributed systems and microservices architecture.
* Excellent communication skills in English



  





**What's on offer** 



* Market-leading compensation and equity package
* Working in a dynamic, innovative company at the forefront of technology.
* The opportunity to make a significant impact when building systems from the ground up.

title: Azure DevOps Platform Engineer | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Unlock your potential with us! Join our elite team shaping DevSecOps solutions for the bank’s developer community.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we will help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As an Azure DevOps Platform Engineer, you will be a part of a highly skilled team providing high-quality enterprise-level services to our developer community, including source control, asset repositories and static code analysis. Your understanding of the development landscape will play an important part in your daily work, but you will also dive into the technical details of our platforms.
   

  

 The team works according to agile principles, with constantly improving and maintaining our platform. We provide highly qualified support to our users, the SEB developer community. Building automations and integrations is the foundation for providing enterprise-level services.
   

  

 We currently host our services on-premises but are preparing to transition to SaaS and cloud services. SEB has chosen to adopt a SaaS and Cloud first strategy, and our team is one of the key enablers of this.
   

  

 In this role, you would take the main responsibility for our existing Azure DevOps environment and be a part of forming our next generation CI/CD services in the cloud. You are expected to be service-minded, communicative, and pedagogical. We work with online courses, tutorials, and presentations to educate our users. As a team, we embrace equality, diversity, and inclusion.
   

  

**Who you are:**
 We are looking for someone with experience in Azure DevOps with good knowledge of Azure DevOps source code management and pipeline orchestration.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a drive to find the best solutions
* Effective communication skills in English
* A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* The will and interest to support our users.
* Knowledge in several of the following areas, practices, and products is beneficial:
* Experience of Windows and Linux
* Experience of containers and Kubernetes
* Experience of Cloud platforms
* Git, GitHub, GitHub Actions
* Artifactory
* A solid understanding of programming and scripting


**What we offer:**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
 ***Due to summer vacation, we will start going through applications in the beginning of August.***
 However, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than July 31st 2024.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact Anton Hänni Talent Acquisition Partner anton.hanni @seb.se.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Technical Lead (Area Lead Engineer) - Innovation - Strategy, Innovation and Business Development
description:
**Company Description**
 Strategy, Innovation and Business Development is a newly built function representing a unified strategic muscle around our core business internally, with a 'delivery engine' securing execution of the strategy, and Innovation working across the horizons, with direct impact to advance the core business. Innovation plays a key role in developing the future for fashion, through impact-orientated innovation, supported by technology.
   

  

 Our mission is to support and accelerate innovation and we are in the exciting process of building a new core team with a large collaborative network. We are now looking for a Technical Lead to be a key player in understanding how to leverage the latest advances in technology and what is emerging, to drive impact and capture business value. This is the opportunity to be part of changing the fashion business globally!
   

  

**Job Description**
**What you will do as Technical Lead**
 At H&M we have a strong, value-driven culture characterized by believing in people, teamwork and an entrepreneurial spirit. Here you can be yourself and develop. You’ll be part of one of the most important areas at H&M Group to achieve our growth goals with significant opportunities to influence and make a difference.
   

  

 We offer you the freedom and opportunity to get creative, to decide how we can exploit the latest technologies and tools to achieve our strategic priorities, in a creative environment, with a laser focus on potential to scale and create commercial value. This is not innovation theatre.
   

  

 This role holder will:
   

  

* Work with professional software engineering practices & best practices and liaise with H&M business Tech teams to go from ideation to exploration and on to actual development of trials, experiments, PoC’s or prototypes within digital ecosystems. As examples, this could include initiatives working on the future of the physical and digital retail experience
* Oversee the conception and development of software solutions relating to the unit's work, typically tests, experiments, or prototype builds
* Use their creative, innovators mindset to be able to translate strategic imperatives into inventive yet scalable solution design
* Collaborate closely with business design and other teams, share best practice and evangelize innovation at H&M Group both internally and externally. They will work not solely as an engineer who waits for clear requirements, but fully contributing to the innovation funnel at all stages, ideation, defining propositions, and how success will be measured
* Use your knowledge of the required languages and frameworks to lead the creation of everything from proof of concepts to complete systems
* Share knowledge within the team and the wider engineering community
* Provide coaching and support for the Software engineers


**Qualifications**
**Your Mindset & Skills**
 Mindset is so important in this role. Innovation calls for creative thinkers, but this small team will need someone happy to shift from applying their critical thinking to rolling up their sleeves to get the job done. Our projects are often exploratory and will be shaped along the way, by the team. Innovation will naturally mean some failures, but this team will drive to land some stellar successes that meet our business ambition. We want people who are experienced in working with and influencing at all levels in an organization.
   

  

 From a skills perspective we need:
   

  

* At least 8 years of experience as Software Engineer with back and front-end experience and a solid understanding of retail tech stacks
* Proven ability to translate the complexity and ambiguity of innovative ideas into something logical and workable
* Proven ability to build physical and digital prototypes
* Understanding of product development and design thinking principles and practices
* Fluent in English (written and spoken)
* A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Hands-on experience of DevOps or equivalent for source code control
* Experience with Java, Kotlin, Swift, JavaScript & NodeJS, HTML & CSS, or Python
* Good knowledge of the full development stack, including databases & APIs
* Experience using SQL & NoSQL Databases
* Strong experience with cloud platforms (we are on GCP)
* Experience with technologies including Machine Learning/AI, computer vision, electronics, would be very beneficial


**Additional Information**
 Do you think we are a match? We hope so! H&M is a people centric employer who offers flexibility.
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, flexible work life, learning communities, wellness benefits, parental benefits etc. you are joining a unique value driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. There are endless opportunities to experiment and grow in any direction that you want and when you grow, we grow. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is a value-driven company that wants to lead the way to a more inclusive environment. We are committed to create an inclusive & diverse workplace with a culture that is dynamic and innovative.
   

  

 We welcome your application regardless of who you are, where you’re from and what you like.
   

  

 We welcome applicants with different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome all applicants to strengthen our innovative and diverse culture. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts

title: Cloud Technical Architect
description:
Atos supports the digital transformation of its clients across all business sectors. Become part of our Cloud Competence Practice and work as a lead technical architect in a challenging enterprise environment.
   

  

**Your role as a Cloud Architect @Atos**
* We are looking for a Cloud Technical Architect to work on internal and customer projects for a broad variety of clients worldwide. This position provides you with autonomy, flexibility and of course enough challenges to learn and develop your professional as well your personal skills. Your work location will be at one of our offices in the Netherlands or at a customer site.
* Your day-to-day responsibilities will include
* working towards completing architecture/design and implementation of services to manage and migrate workloads to cloud-based PaaS, IaaS and SaaS products
* responsible for leading the creation of technology frameworks and providing technical leadership in internal and customer initiatives with a focus on the design of cloud-based services across the stack including Microservices, Containers, Container Platforms and DevOps
* engage with customers to understand their business challenges and requirements and help the customer’s design & implement new methodologies and IT service frameworks and maximize the business around the cloud service platforms
* work with customers throughout the whole modernization journey, providing comprehensive support to transform and evolve their application portfolios via native cloud development from strategy, to implementation to operations
* transforming legacy applications using modern secure software development methods with a set of proven DevSecOps practices to create the right environment to rapidly launch new services to customers


**Skills We'd Like You To Have**
* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a relevant professional qualification
* Experience in customer facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture and application design discussions with senior customer executives to drive cloud deployment
* Deep understanding and experience in working with one or more Public Cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google) and on-premises environments
* Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging trends
* Solid understanding of cloud virtualization, storage and networking & security solutions
* Understanding of cloud governance technologies for cost management and control
* Deep understanding of cloud-based Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery practices
* Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts & ensuring follow-up
* Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences
* Prior work experience in a consulting/architecture position within software & services company
* Takes ownership and shows commitment, team player with an open mind and positive attitude
* Exceptional verbal and written communication
* Preferred language Dutch or English business fluent


**We offer**
 At Atos, technology and innovation are central. Atos wants to be an inspiring and facilitating employer, so that you continue to develop and improve yourself professionally and personally. Because even if you are an experienced professional, it is essential to keep up and develop yourself. Our Atos University offers many possibilities for this. The benefits we offer are
   

  

* A good salary and attractive benefits (such as an end-of-year bonus and a pension scheme)
* An informal working atmosphere with result-oriented colleagues and an involved manager
* 29 vacation days per year
* A lease car or mobility budget
* Flexible working comes in many forms at Atos. From part-time work arrangements to flexibility in where you work, when you work and how you work. For this role remote working is possible.
* The opportunity to work on complex projects for appealing clients where you can develop yourself
* Excellent (international) career opportunities
* Extensive training and development programs
* Competency groups where you can learn from others and share your own experiences.

title: Solution Architect
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 HPE Services is our innovative IT services organization. It provides the expertise to advise, integrate, and accelerate our customers’ outcomes from their digital transformation – giving clients the most effective solutions for a fast-paced, modern business along with the expertise to achieve maximum business benefit, and to deliver better experiences.
   

  

**In a typical day as a Solution Architect, you would:**
* Establish trusted advisor relationships at senior levels for specific customers.
* Craft detailed and well-documented hybrid cloud solutions that address the specific needs and challenges presented in an RFP in close collaboration with the sales team.
* Collaborate with business units, conduct workshops, and gather detailed technical requirements.
* Facilitate goal-aligned discussions with customer stakeholders and propose technical solutions aligned on HPE’s and partner portfolio.
* Provide strategic guidance for hybrid cloud adoption, aligning with business objectives.
* Develop cost models and recommend strategies for optimal cloud spending.
* Define and communicate the hybrid cloud adoption roadmap, including key milestones.
* Design end-to-end hybrid cloud architectures, seamlessly integrating on-premises infrastructure.
* Lead implementation, ensuring compliance, security, and adherence to best practices.
* Oversee migration of applications and data between on-premises and cloud.
* Continuously monitor and optimize hybrid cloud performance, implementing automation.
* Stay updated on emerging technologies, trends, and best practices and assist with the development of the technical community.


**Your Technical Skills**
* At least 7 years of experience in IT Architecture
* Very good market knowledge of IT consulting services in the field of cloud transformation, including IaaS/PaaS, DevOps, CI/CD, containers
* Familiarity with ITIL/ITSM is preferred
* Knowledge of Linux, Windows OS, Kubernetes, Microsoft Azure and microservices would be nice to have
* Proven experience as an Infrastructure Architect or similar role, preferably in a large-scale enterprise environment.
* Strong knowledge and understanding of IT infrastructure components, including servers, networking, storage, and virtualization technologies.
* Proficient in infrastructure design and architecture methodologies.
* Solid understanding of cloud computing and hybrid infrastructure models.


**Your Professional Skills**
* A strong professional with consistent business acumen and general management leadership abilities including accountability.
* Able to build relationships with C-level executives in client organizations.
* Excellent in verbal and written communication and presentation.
* Native in Swedish and fluent in English languages (in writing and speaking).


 If you are passionate about cloud technologies, have a track record of successful cloud implementations, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to shape the future of the cloud architectures of our customers.
   

  

**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Growth, Client Expectations Management, Coaching, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Centric Solutions, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Information Technology (IT) Infrastructure, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Intellectual Curiosity, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Process Improvements, Product Services, Relationship Building {+ 5 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #servicesandsupport
   

  

**Job**
 Services
   

  

**Job Level**
 TCP\_04
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
Our client
 **Oriola** 
 is looking for an
 








  





**Enterprise Architect** 




  





 to join Oriola IT/Digital team for a permanent position based either in Sweden or Finland.
 



  





 As an Enterprise Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing the overall technology landscape and strategy of Oriola - health and wellbeing company operating in the Nordic countries. You will collaborate with stakeholders, IT teams, and business leaders to align technology solutions with business objectives. You will be part of the IT/Digital leadership team. If you are a strategic thinker with a strong technical background and a passion for driving innovation, we invite you to apply.
 



  





**Your are responsible to** 



* Develop and maintain the enterprise architecture framework, standards, and principles to guide technology decision-making.
* Analyze business capabilities to determine enterprise priorities.
* Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to understand strategic goals and translate them into technology roadmaps and solutions.
* Build capability roadmaps to provide focus on strategic objectives and clarity on the specific sequence of activities and time frames for execution.
* Conduct analysis of current systems, applications, and infrastructure to identify opportunities for improvement, optimization, and innovation.
* Lead the design and implementation of the enterprise architecture, ensuring alignment with business needs, scalability, security, and performance.
* Evaluate emerging technologies and trends to identify potential benefits and risks for the organization.
* Provide technical guidance and expertise to project teams, ensuring adherence to architectural standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with IT teams and vendors to evaluate and select appropriate technology solutions.
* Communicate and present complex architectural concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



  





**We expect from you** 



* Proven experience as an Enterprise Architect or a similar role in large-scale, complex environments.
* Strong knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks and understanding of infrastructure, application, data, and security architectures.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
* Good interpersonal skills and development mindset with problem-solving “can do” attitude to secure cooperation with different stakeholders.
* You are analytical and have ability to understand business stakeholder needs and you are able to translate technical matters fluently to business language.
* Fluent spoken and written English
* Willingness to travelling.
* Certifications such as TOGAF, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect are a plus.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or other relevant field.



  





**We offer you** 



* Meaningful work in purpose driven organisation, Health for life
* Great team spirit and fun colleagues from Sweden and Finland
* Interesting forward leaning organisation with high ambitious for sustainability
* Organisation which gives independency and responsibility to develop Organisation with Scandinavian view and some travelling
* Interesting business in the middle of the health industry from B2B service business to B2C customer relations.



  





 In Oriola, interesting and challenging future looking role, and excellent opportunities for professional growth in changing business environment is waiting for you. Based on our values our work environment supports the following behavior: we are open, we take initiative, we take responsibility, and we work together.
 



  





 This position is based in either in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Enköping.
 



  





 Please,
 **apply ASAP** 
 as this position will be fulfilled when the right candidate has been found.
 



  





 For any more details, please contact on
 **pekka.back@ictdirect.io tel +46 737 168 307.** 




  





***Oriola***
*is a health and wellbeing company operating in the Nordic countries. We are driven by our purpose, Health for life and we have set ambitious sustainability targets to support wellbeing of people, society, and planet. To ensure this, our business keeps evolving. We are growing and developing within health and wellbeing and developing our services. Our significant role in society gives a great purpose for working with us. In return, we expect you to aim as high as we do. You will need to be customer oriented and proactive. Together we work towards an even healthier future.*

title: Välkänt IoT bolag söker Data Engineer
description:
Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över söker dig som drivs av komplex datahantering och arbetat med stora dataflöden
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm, Sverige
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet till distansbarbete 2 dagar i veckan
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augsti/September
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över.
   

 Detta företag är en global ledare inom IoT och hanterar mer än 20 miljoner uppkopplingar för multinationella kunder som Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct och Husqvarna. De erbjuder enkel och tillförlitlig tillgång till varje marknad i världen och möjliggör för branschledande aktörer att koppla upp sina produkter och tjänster på global skala över alla vertikaler.
   

 Företaget är rankat topp tre bästa IoT-operatörerna i Europa och bland de tio bästa i världen. Med huvudkontor och tekniskt centrum beläget i Norden har de försäljningsrepresentation i Storbritannien, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Sydafrika, Sydkorea, Kina, Taiwan och Japan.
 


  

  

**Tjänsten och teamet**
  


 De söker en erfaren Data Engineer med utmärkta färdigheter inom avancerad och modern databehandling av stora volymer och hastigheter för att gå med i deras team.
   

 I denna position är teamet ansvarigt för:
 


  

  
* Arkitektur och utveckling av deras dataplattform, inklusive insamling, bearbetning och förberedelse av data – både batch och realtidsdata.
  
* Utveckling av analysrapporter och verktyg.
  
* Utveckling och hantering av ML-modeller.
  
* Piloter och implementering av AI-användningsfall i produktion.
  
* Teamet har också ett DevOps-ansvar vilket innebär att "det vi bygger, det driver vi också".
   

 Datateamet interagerar och levererar affärsvärde till nästan alla delar av organisationen. Teamet är också ansvarigt för att leverera direkt kundvärde, antingen genom att stödja kundnära kollegor eller via kundnära datalösningar.
   

 Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att bli en del av ett moget och effektivt datateam med stor exponering mot den globala verksamheten.
   

 Denna roll rapporterar till Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) och är placerad i Stockholm, Karlskrona eller Göteborg.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 För att lyckas i denna position ska man ha omfattande erfarenhet och färdigheter inom:
 


  

  
* Big data
  
* Utveckling inom Python eller Java
  
* Molnutveckling / Dev-ops
  


  

  

**Andra krav**
  

  
* MSc i mjukvaru-/dataingenjör eller liknande
  
* Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska och helst svenska
  


  


  

**Meriterande teknologier / frameworks**



  

  
* Big data teknologier som: Apache-frameworks (Iceberg, Flink, PySpark, etc)
  
* AWS services som: Glue, StepFunctions, Athen/Trino
  
* Verktyg för dataanalys/ML/AI: Pandas, etc
  


  


  

**Meriterande arbetsmetoder**



  

  
* CI/CD designmönster
  
* Dataorienterade testfall
  
* Hantering av referensdata
  
* Distribuerade arbetsbelastningar inklusive partitionsstrategier
  
* Skalbara databehandlingsmönster
  


  


 Stor vikt läggs vid erfarenhet av att hantera höga och växande datavolymer. Om man har varit en del av ett team som stött på skalningsproblem och löst det på ett innovativt sätt är man en bra kandidat. Kandidater bör också vara kunniga inom säker design och åtkomstmönster, och helst ha en AWS-certifiering.
 


  

  

**Som person**
  


 De söker en engagerad och självdriven person med en positiv och optimistisk inställning. Man ska inte vara rädd för att ta stort ansvar, vara affärsorienterad och bra med människor. Man ska älska att dela tekniskt kunnande och god praxis. Teamet delar en testdriven inställning och ett gemensamt intresse för att arbeta över flera miljöer och programmeringsspråk, utnyttjande av molnets krafter.
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Första steg i denna process kommer vara beteende och logik tester.
   

 Därefter telefonavstämning samt tekniskt test.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Anton Hegart eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104900

title: Identity & Access Management Consultant
description:
**We Are**
 Accenture Security helps organizations prepare, protect, detect, respond, and recover along with all points of the security lifecycle. Cybersecurity challenges are different for every business in every industry. Leveraging our global resources and advanced technologies, we create integrated, turnkey solutions tailored to our client's needs across their entire value chain. Whether we’re defending against known cyberattacks, detecting and responding to the unknown, or running an entire security operations center, we will help companies build cyber resilience to grow with confidence. Our team of the security sector’s brightest people uses the coolest tech to out-hack the hackers and help clients build resilience from within. We blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security, and managed service solutions to rethink the entire security lifecycle.
   

  

 Do you have the deep functional and technical experience to help implement security solutions that align with our clients’ business objectives? Do you have the expertise to design and deliver solutions for establishing system user's credentials, and processes for applying those credentials to access enterprise systems and applications? If so, read on and apply. Accenture’s more than 2,000 security professionals deliver holistic and proactive security solutions in 47 countries, and we’d love to discuss our open Identity and Access Management (I&AM) Security role with you.
   

  

**You Are**
 A cyber security savant. You’ve got the skills and experience to keep data safe from black hat hackers or other threats, whether by coding a threat intrusion module or sharing your latest ideas with the team. Day-to-day, you’re all about solving security problems for clients and using your people skills to make sure everyone on your team is working well and happily.
   

  

 You are passionate about security, love what you do and have a genuine desire to outsmart the bad guys. You have the experience to analyze a clients’ security posture, anticipate security requirements and help find right-sized solutions based on industry leading practices. You have a proven track record working successfully in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. You’re a creative, analytical problem solver with above average documentation skills who can speak to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are eager to put your skills to use by helping us help our clients inject security at every level of their organization.
   

  

**The Work**
 The Identity and Access Management Security Specialist has the primary responsibility for the management and day-to-day operation of Fortune 500 Customer’s Identity Management systems and tools. This position will provide a successful level of service to business partners and end customers while adhering to web security and risk policies and standards throughout the enterprise.
   

  

  

- Install, integrate, configure, and deploy IAM solutions and systems to facilitate User Life-Cycle Management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, Single Sign-On, Federation, Privileged Account Management.

- Manage the complex PAM infrastructure and operations for the premier customer. Infrastructure includes multiple Servers for Enterprise password Vaults, DR Vault, Central policy Managers, Load balanced PVWAs, Application access Manager, Windows and Unix and On-demand Session managers, Privileged Threat Analytics, End Point Manager, SCIM servers, Enterprise backup solutions, for Safes and recordings backups

- Ensure an uninterrupted password change and reconciliation and session monitoring services for the windows, Unix and other Privileged administrators and business users’ activities

- Hands on experience in trouble shooting issues related to password rotation, account onboarding, monitoring, integrations with AD/ LDAP, SIEM Solutions and other integrations

- Develop and execute test cases and test plans for IAM solutions

- Responsible for Privileged User account administration of various Windows and UNIX accounts, Database and Network devices, Service accounts, DevOps and Scanning and Scripting Accounts

- Deep experience with Windows Operating Systems, UNIX/Linux and environments, IIS, SSO, Database and Application Servers, Authentication Products and ITSMs

- Integrating various platforms such as different LDAP providers, Windows Servers, UNIX Servers, Databases and networking Devices

- Creating and Managing Safes, Platforms and Owners, Managing Safes, recording backups

- Experience in installing or upgrading PAM solutions and connectors

- Perform health check monitoring on all severs to ensure consistent availability of system to end user

- Manage and evaluate the effectiveness of the enterprise's PAM Solutions and Services to ensure they provide the intended level of availability.

 Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.
   

  

**Here’s What You Need**
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)

- Minimum of 2 years of experience with managing cloud privileged Identities on various cloud platforms

- Experience in AD, lDAP, JDBC, SNOW connectors and end to end life cycle management

- Minimum 3 years of experience in at least one of the following IAM Vendor technologies or skills

- Saviynt: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud (EIC), Saviynt Third Party Access Governance, Saviynt Cloud Privileged Access Management, Saviynt Application Access Governance

- SailPoint: SailPoint IdentityIQ, SailPoint IdentityNow, SailPoint SecurityIQ

- CyberArk: CyberArk Alero for Vendor Access Management, PSM for Cloud, Conjur / DevOps Secrets management

- Ping: PingAccess ,PingID, PingFederate, PingDirectory, PingOne, PingAuthorize, PingIntellegence

**Bonus points if you have:**
- Exposure to I&AM practitioners and experts

- Prior work experience serving C-Level clients as a security consultant

- Industry-adopted security certifications (e.g. CISSP), as well as I&AM vendor or industry certification such as:

- Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM)

- SailPoint Certified Identity Professional Program Certifications

- ForgeRock Certified Access Management Specialist

- ForgeRock Certified Identity Management Specialist

- Prior experience in the deployment and implementation of custom applications

- Experience with any of the following security areas:

- Information risk, privacy, and strategy (i.e. security and privacy policies, or risk assessments, or security and privacy compliance);

- Application security (i.e. application security testing or security integrations with Systems Development Lifecycle (SDL)

- Infrastructure security; (i.e.- securing networks and servers or security monitoring)

- Data security or encryption

- Prior experience with any of the following:

- Provisioning Onboarding

- RBAC Authorization models

- SSO WAC technologies Enterprise SSO

- Federation

- Privilege User Management

- Directory Services Meta-Directory Virtual Directory

- Authentication Methods

- Entitlement Management

- OAUTH, OpenID Connect

- XACML

- JSON, REST, SOAP

- HTML5, IQuery, Node.js Location: Stockholm

**We look forward to learning more about you!** 
 Apply online, attach your CV and letter of application in English. If you have any questions, please contact responsible recruiter: karl.kego@accenture.com

title: Network Security Engineer
description:
🏃‍♀️
 **About Redeploy Ru** 
**n**
 At Redeploy Run, we specialize in platform engineering and operations, helping our customers simplify their infrastructure and speed up application delivery. Our mission is to make cloud adoption faster and easier.
   

  

 Our 'Ready-to-Run' platform products, including Technology Platforms and Industry Cloud Platforms, let IT departments and developers manage infrastructure and governance with ease. Leveraging Infrastructure as Code, container-based services, CI/CD, and Kubernetes, and collaborating with cloud providers like Azure and AWS, we tackle complex problems, enhance our tools, and provide guidance to help customers get the most of their cloud platforms.
   

  

 As a rapidly growing cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for both senior and junior Network Security Engineers who want to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?
   

  

**✍** 
**About the role**
 As Network Security Engineer, you’ll join our Operations team who has a responsibility for ensuring the security and operations of our diverse customers’ network infrastructures across cloud environments (Azure and AWS) and on-premises systems.
   

  

 In this role, your focus will be on operations and to implement, manage, and maintain network security measures for multiple customers using Fortigate and Checkpoint solutions. Some of your tasks will amongst others be:
   

  

* Designing and managing security protocols and policies for cloud environments.
* Securing on-premises infrastructures, including firewalls and VPNs.
* Monitoring network traffic for unusual activities, analyzing security threats, and responding to incidents.
* Configuring and managing security settings, firewall rules, and VPN connections to ensure optimal performance and security.
* Documenting security configurations, policies, and incidents as well as preparing reports for customers and internal use.
* Diagnosing and resolving network security issues for our customers and providing advice and expertise to resolve any related technical problems.
* Staying updated with the latest security trends, threats and technologies.


 We provide our customers 24/7 support for urgent network security issues and incidents, and you will be part of an on-call rotation scheme and offered extra compensation for your efforts.
   

  

**🎯** 
**Who are you?**
 We believe you have a keen interest for networking, security and cloud and that you enjoy creating value and solving problems for clients. You are a strong believer in automation, making things faster and have a willingness to continuously learn and adapt to new technologies and security challenges.
   

  

 We are looking for several new colleagues to join us - either you are senior with several years commercial experience in the field and are searching for your next challenge, or you just started your career in networking and security and are looking for a place where you can learn the ins and outs of the field by experienced professionals.
   

  

**Other than that, we see that you come with following experiences:**
* Experience as a Network Security Engineer, with expertise in Fortigate and Checkpoint products.
* Strong knowledge of network protocols, firewall management.
* Experience with cloud networking and security in Azure and AWS environments.
* Familiarity with security best practices, compliance standards, and risk management.
* Experience in automation and DevOps practices.
* Experience and knowledge of Terraform, Go, Python, Bash, Powershell, or similar to support automation.


*(For juniors* 
 we see that you have an education in related field, as well as basic understanding of the mentioned experiences above).
   

  

**And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage**
* Relevant certifications such as Fortinet NSE, or Checkpoint CCS(X)


 🤝
 **What we offer**
 Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.
   

  

 Want to learn more about our benefits package? Find more info here: https://careers.redeploy.com/
   

  

 📍
 **Location**
 Our office is located in central Stockholm at Torsgatan 4. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location.
   

  

**📩** 
**Ready to join the team?**
 We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
   

  

 We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Head of Redeploy Run Jonas Erikson - Jonas.Erikson@Redeploy.com.
   

  

 We look forward hearing from you!

title: Embeddedutvecklare inom cybersecurity & cloud
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi accelererar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.
   

  

 Vi är 19 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.
   

  

 Making Future
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Är du en mjukvaruutvecklare med stort intresse av inbyggda system och har minst ett års erfarenhet? Vill du ha möjlighet att prova på många olika jobb utan att behöva byta arbetsgivare? Då är konsultrollen på AFRY något för dig! Här får du chansen att utveckla produkter, arbeta i flertalet branscher och företag men samtidigt behålla en trygg och säker anställning.
   

  

 Att jobba som konsult inom inbyggda system på AFRY innebär att du får jobba med kollegor som är hängivna tekniken och ligger i framkant vad gäller både mjuk- och hårdvaruutveckling.
   

  

 På AFRY har du en trygg anställning och vår övertygelse är att nöjda medarbetare är vårt recept för framgång! Vi är måna om att du ska trivas på ditt uppdrag, att du känner att du utvecklas, men också att du har utrymme för en meningsfull fritid.
   

  

 För oss inom produktutveckling har vi ett stort antal kunder inom hela stor-Stockholm, vi har uppdrag inom bland annat konsumentprodukter, energi, elektrifiering, telekommunikation, medicinteknik och försvar. Branschen präglas av innovation och nytänkande både inom hård- och mjukvara. Det finns allt ifrån unga, mindre företag med stor flexibilitet och frihet till stora väletablerade företag med uppstyrda roller och processer. Här finns något för alla! Vanligaste programmeringsspråken är C och C++, men det finns många fler inom detta område. Meriterande är t.ex kunskap inom: Cloud, Cyber Security, Java, Python, C#, Linux, DevOps-kunskaper m.fl.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer dina arbetsuppgifter variera eftersom du kommer delta i små och stora projekt, såväl inhouse som ute hos våra kunder. Beroende på uppdrag kan dina arbetsuppgifter exempelvis vara att utveckla mjukvara för hårdvarunära applikationer. Du kommer arbeta med testramverk och ibland definiera dem. Vidare arbetsuppgifter kan vara att effektivisera och modernisera befintliga produkter för optimal prestanda.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som vill lära nytt och utvecklas hos oss! Vi tror att det du inte redan kan, det kommer du att lära dig. Vågar du utmana, är hängiven tekniken, har ett teambaserat mindset och vill vara en del av ett fantastiskt härligt gäng så kommer du trivas hos oss på AFRY.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta agilt och med att utveckla nya eller befintliga system/funktioner i våra kunders system, både egenutvecklade och gemensamma system inom embedded.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har en högskoleutbildning inom relevant område. Eftersom utveckling, modellering och testning sker främst i C/C ++ och i Linuxplattformar är det önskvärt med minst ett par års erfarenhet inom utveckling och/eller test. Flytande svenska och engelska är ett krav.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, orädd och en "doer" som får saker gjorda! Du tycker om att träffa nya människor i olika konstellationer och bryr dig lika mycket om dina kollegor som dina arbetsuppgifter. Du bidrar med din energi och kreativitet och du vill ha roligt på jobbet!
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Du kommer att arbeta inom intressanta områden och miljöer med varierande arbetsuppgifter. Din utveckling är central och vi kommer att försöka hitta det uppdrag som passar just dig och din utveckling.
